author: {'steamid': '76561197972719311', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3473, 'last_played': 1734562385}
review: Not yet, wait for release.  Campaign is good, bosses are excellent, overall combat feels solid.  But skill selection is currently limited, crafting is awful, uniques feel like placeholders, maps are far too large, and the endgame is just tedious and unrewarding.  Foundation is good though, another 6-12 months of iteration and this could be great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004534822', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1734347903}
review:
The most poorly designed and tuned ARPG I've ever played. GGG chose to go all in on Souls ripoff dodge rolling, they chose to go in on Ruthless loot deprivation in Standard league, they chose to add 100 bosses all with generic one shot slams. They've made an experience that's more frustrating and less rewarding than POE1 in every way. I've beaten Dark Souls, POE uber bosses, Shadow of the Erdtree. POE2's Act 1 is as hard as their endgames, and I can't possibly see that as a positive. There aren't even good rewards. The loot is sparse, with Act bosses dropping maybe a couple of blues, and terrible, with those blues being usable by your build maybe 10% of the time. Get a unique? Too bad, it's not for your class!

The new skill system is terrible, with defensive, movement, and buff skills being stripped away for... nothing? Your basic auto attack scales better than every offensive skill in the game?? Defensive abilities and passives have been almost completely stripped from the game, leaving the mighty *dodge roll* as your only defensive option. Even in Act 1 bosses will kill you instantly with every telegraphed attack, generic mob packs can melt fully defensive melee characters in under a second, and things hit so hard you have to dodge individual melee attacks. There are not enough defensive options to build your character to a point where you can survive mistakes or even basic melee attacks without endless rolling. It's repetitive, it sucks, it's very poor design to have only one defensive option with no alternatives. Suck at dodge rolling, have bad reflexes, have a bad internet connection? You just got "filtered", bud! Git gud!!!

The game didn't feel like it was opening up the longer I played, it felt like it was getting more unbalanced and oppressive the further I went. By Act 2 the mob density, damage, and health was so outpacing my character that I could barely go a single screen without having to port out and replenish my healing flask, as basic melee attacks were doing over half my health, to a melee class, making the slog even slower and worse. Then I learned to ascend my character they've replaced the fun and enticing Labyrinth with... Sanctum!! Enjoy, melee characters, getting your ascension runs bricked because you can take 10 auto attacks the entire run before running out of Honor! With Act 1&2 bosses having multiple one-shots and minute long invincibility phases where they spam attacks, I'm not sure where the difficulty goes from there, but it's probably not good. 

All of these problems are intentional design decisions. They've chosen to make a slower, harder, grindier, less rewarding game. The story is completely mind numbing, I've never consciously registered the presence of music on anything but the title screen, and the graphics don't look nearly good enough to run as poorly as they do. Gameplay is all POE2 has to offer, and it's not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058033313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 469, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1736736503}
review: This game would be a lot more enjoyable had it an offline option. Self made offline or something. The constant mini hickups are ruining the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085213530', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 781, 'playtime_at_review': 2715, 'last_played': 1736780777}
review:
As a huge fan of PoE 1 (+2500hours), I was quite hyped with this opus. Now, I am disappointed.
Indeed, in my opinion (and it is only my opinion), the game doesn't feels good to play. Doesn't feel like Path of Exile.


- Game is slow, movement are slow, no movements spells or dashes

- Maps are HUGE, could be cool, if they weren't resetting when you die, so you have to re-clear the whole map, and thus, take hours to clear a simple map (shouldn't be the case during acts imo)

-No enough checkpoints in some acts / maps, (is problematic because the previous point.)

- Classes aren't balanced between melees and ranged (Melee is tough as hell)

- Lot of bugs (Still in early access, so it is quite fine tbh)

- Small to almost no loots

- Personnal preference : I do not like the dark souls feeling, with the add of the dodge

- Crafting is not as fun as in PoE 1, feels empty

- Passive tree feels too trivial

- Tree passive respec is super expensive

- Lot of boss, and they almost drop nothing, no rewards


There are some goods things tho, graphisms are awesome, acts building are insane (act 2 with the caravan mechanic for exemple). 

I hope these negatives points will be changed in futures patches, and that they will not abandon PoE 1 to maintain this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133571088', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 13488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3345, 'playtime_at_review': 8227, 'last_played': 1736798198}
review:
campaign is fun, endgame is the worst thing i've ever played in my life. sweat your nuts off for some waystones just to get one shot by some fat cunt that you can't even see sitting off the screen

never had a game crash so much. lucky if i can play for 20 minutes before it freezes the pc, leading to a force restart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092231418', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1733611151}
review:
I'm not a souls-like player at all, so not really the target demographic for this, but that's not really one of my main concerns so far. My main issue is there just isn't that same dopamine hit compared to POE1, aside from killing bosses which is rightfully deserved. Progression feels lackluster and it's hard to get excited about leveling up when the skill tree, despite being bigger, is full of so much garbage it feels like no real progress is being made. Same with the loot, I got some pretty decent stuff at the beginning but now in Act 2, maybe I'll get a shitty magical item that doesn't even work with my class well at best per map. Crafting orbs are practically nonexistent, at least the ones that upgrade rarity, still have a million Augmentation orbs with nothing worth using them on. Why the fuck am I kiting white mobs for 45 mins per map, and the crowding also gets pretty bad in certain areas but good use of dodge can mitigate that. Gems system, while made a lot easier to understand, doesn't have the same depth and the fun of throwing random shit together and winging it isn't there anymore. 

Overall not a bad game, but coming from POE1 and not Souls-likes or any other ARPG, it's just not my cup of tea and while I'm sure I'll keep playing for a while to up until I can't stand it anymore, it feels like that's going to be sooner rather than later with how unrewarding the current systems are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039202106', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2748, 'last_played': 1734028738}
review:
tldr: wait for at least few patches and balancing imo
tldr2: post-act burnout, worth it only if you really want to check out what devs have prepared so far and/or support them, but I'm not sane enought to stay for mapping

Grinded to about level 40 and it doesn't feel that good here in EA.

Overall, the game looks beautiful, the ideas are cool, and some boss fights feel genuinely enjoyable—if you're lucky enough to face them on even terms.

Now for the downsides: progression is terrible. The new skill system is more restrictive: it’s divided into "only maces" or "only staves" instead of the broader categories like "blunt," "sharp," or "melee." Experimentation is less encouraged. For instance, in PoE1, testing a different skill or skill combo cost a negligible amount of currency, which was easy to acquire. In PoE2, skills and their modifiers are rare and random loot. A failed attempt at improving your character’s power essentially punishes you until the RNG gods decide to give you another chance.

The same goes for gear. Now, even blue items can't be freely re-rolled: you get just one shot at crafting. If you end up with garbage, tough luck—sell it to a vendor for peanuts. Crafting currency has become rarer, and there are fewer opportunities to deliberately improve your setup. Gear drops have also become less frequent, and it’s all too common to kill a boss, a rare mob, or open a golden chest only to receive absolutely nothing useful or valuable. And this happens over and over.

At state of mid-third act, the game feels like a casino simulator, where players have even less control over the outcomes. This trend aligns with the direction of recent updates and leagues in PoE1.

The gameplay is occasionally unpolished, but mostly just tedious. Maps have become larger, movement is slower, and when you die, trash mobs respawn, forcing you to clear them all over again. With the slower pace, it sometimes feels like certain mobs were designed for the old zoom-zoom gameplay, where you “clear from off-screen or die.” They leap, teleport, or rush at you with absurd speed, leaving no option but to roll away and spam AoE beneath your feet until everything around you is dead. At least, that’s how it feels playing as a ranged character with a crossbow.

The old PoE problems like lack of visual clarity and clear telegraphing of attacks haven’t gone anywhere. The only improvement is that these issues seem slightly less frequent in a few rare cases.

I hope that balancing and loot issues will be fixed by letting devs cook, at the moment it just doesn't feel good

Post act:

Well, I’ve skill-issued myself through all the acts, so here’s the update. The main points have remained the same, and I see the developers are already carefully working on changes, so there will be improvements. You can see how long it took me (45 hours at the time of writing this review). Most of that time was spent walking. My guess is that it could be optimized to around 25 hours (in the best-case scenario) with higher movement speed, a more meta build, proper gear, and efficient pathing. However, even that feels like a lot if you consider having to re-run it for every character in every league.

While I think movement speed in combat is fine, as there are ways to mitigate the slowdown from attacking and to increase general movement speed slightly, we really need something to boost our speed outside of combat. I doubt any developer will read this, but a good long-term solution would be to add mounts, or running, though that sounds less exciting. A mount would be cool, and the game already has some MTX for out-of-combat movement. Besides, there’s an abandoned Rhoa sitting somewhere in Deshar. We can’t just leave this poor creature all alone; maybe it could come with us?

Dodge rolling is already being worked on, but I think each class should have its own way of improving it, whether through ascendancy, a passive tree node, or a gem. While there’s currently one spirit gem that changes how dodge works, I don’t think that’s an ideal solution. 

The best thing about the current gem system is the ability to create skill combos, and I’m excited to see how the developers expand on this idea. However, it feels a bit limited and, in some cases, too restrictive. For example, gas can only be ignited by burning enemies and skills with the “detonator” tag, but not by other explosions, burning oil on the ground, or a literal wall of fire, which doesn’t seem logical.

There are also support gems that cause double status procs on enemies to trigger effects, but I’m particularly interested in seeing them expand on AoE or ground effect mix-ups. It feels incredibly satisfying to use them, and not continuing to develop this idea would be a huge missed opportunity. I also hope weapon restrictions on gems will be eased slightly. While weapon-specific skills are fine and can lead to interesting designs, it’s important to provide more general, all-around options like we’ve had in the past.

Regarding the acts themselves, the best part is generally the bosses, god I hope they'll make pure bossing acts. Act 1 feels decent in this regard, Act 2 is a bit unpolished, and Act 3 is top-tier (though I’m a big fan of Vaal aesthetics, so I might be biased). The bosses I didn’t enjoy were the Kitava-imposter types. I’m not sure if it’s just me, but they feel like they need more work.

In terms of telegraphing and enemy skill audio/visuals: please, for the love of god, ensure survivability isn’t tied to the physical ability to see things under layers of effects. Enemy skills should have visual priority over player skills, with more dangerous abilities having even higher priority, same for sound queues. If things are already hard to see now, we all know how bad it will get after more mechanics and a few leagues are piled on top. There’s a chance now to improve this and avoid the visual hell that PoE 1 became.

The same goes for mobs that rush or offscreen you. This was frustrating in PoE 1 and remains so here. Rushing mobs should be rare packs designed to challenge and surprise you, not something spammed throughout a location. Trash mobs that offscreen you are even worse. Nobody, and this includes us, should be offscreening anyone. It encourages unengaging gameplay, which is, in my opinion, bad. If you want bigger mob engagement distances, just zoom out the camera a bit so we can see each other. And before anyone complains, I’m not referring to things tied to ranged mechanics—I’m talking about things that try to auto-attack you to death.

As for crafting and currency, the absence of Alteration Orbs feels disappointing. No vendor recipes or crafting bench in is also a letdown. Alchemy Orbs don’t exist in the acts (at least not with my luck), and essences are nearly nonexistent. More common Exalts and new Chaos Orbs are fun, but most deterministic crafting methods seem locked away in maps, which I dislike. Omens for crafting appear to exist (based on what I saw on the currency exchange), but my guess is they won’t be common and will cost a fortune to obtain.

The current passive tree is fine—a decent starting point—but it lacks any significant game-changing options. The Atlas passive tree concept, with its own points for each league, is good in my opinion. I haven’t checked upgrades it provides, but the idea is promising.

If you’ve read this far, you’re not sane, exile, and neither am I. I don’t see myself continuing this journey into map grinding, as I see the same issues persisting there. My legs are weak and slow, and the maps are massive, offering only one chance to complete them for some loot—if you don’t perish first.

It’s been interesting to see what the developers have prepared so far, and I’ll probably check back again sometime later. For now, though, I’m already burned out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989629849', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 7181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 106, 'playtime_at_review': 5740, 'last_played': 1736350604}
review:
Enjoyable campaign. It has a nice gameplay balance where even if the bosses and acts might be difficult for your character, there's always things to learn so that you can overcome the challenge.
A nice mix of rewarding difficulty, and the bosses are really fun.


However, the endgame is PoE Ruthless mini-hardcore. Pure suffering.
The change between campaign and endgame is actually surreal.
GGG advertised a fair deal on being able to couch Co-Op. Yeah, good luck with that in the endgame.
Ascensions paths are way too difficult, even if you have a decent build (Especially since the bosses are spastic and bugged).
You spend +30 mins just to get smacked by badly telegraphed attacks, and lose all progress. On top of that, if you coop, the difficulty basically scales exponentially.
Endgame loot is scarce and with the 1 portal mechanic, you'll often find yourself punished on multiple levels after getting smacked by on-death events. Nice artificial difficulty. No smoothness at all in gameplay.
The game punishes the player so insanely much.
You can have 70-80% armour and evasion, with ~4k life/es and the game will still throw one-shots at you in area levels 70-85.
And since the game doesn't actually teach you on how to fix this (Which is the norm with PoE), you'll just have to take the loss and use other informational channels to gain knowledge.


Crafting is also abhorrent, and feels almost like a waste of what little currency you're getting. (Even with juiced rare/corrupted maps through towers).
Without any alteration orbs or scouring orbs, it's a pretty much throwing currency out the window 1 out of 100 times.
Sure it can it hit, it just never does it when you actually need it.
Oh boy I sure really do love hitting accuracy, attribute requirements, light radius and low tier mods whilst trying to craft on a ilvl +80 item.
The dopamine of hitting that 100th craft just doesn't outweigh the depression of failing 99 crafts.


Map design is both good and bad. Most maps have a decent set artstyle, but they're just way too large, and some of the layouts are missing clear contrast on impassable terrain, which heavily contributes to being hugged to death.
At least they allowed us to teleport between checkpoints in the campaign, but without a similar function in the maps, the map size becomes tedious. Especially with backtracking towards doing league mechanics, or that one Elite enemy that hid behind a rock when you were traversing the first stages of the map.


Atlas is interesting, but being low-key forced to play every type of map, kills the joy when there are layouts that are painful to play through and that really doesn't cooperate with the league mechanics in terms of much space being allocated to said league mechanic.
Sometimes delirium will last for a fairly comfortable time, other times it'll disappear after 20 seconds.
Ritual being placed in a corridor.
Breach and expedition going through a labyrinth of passages.
Not enjoyable at all.


Honestly felt good about the game with the reveal stream and pre-release videos, and going through the campaign.
But I seriously hope that the endgame will be drastically reduced in terms of punishment towards the player.
Otherwise people just won't play.

I'm just feeling scammed with the time I spend into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125040437', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2750, 'last_played': 1734654884}
review: Game is good but runs like shit on some systems. I keep getting locked CPU's when the game crashes resulting in me having to hold power to restart my computer.  People going through the same issue as me have reported damaged components therefore i feel its not worth risking your PC just to play this game. They need to prioritise this issue and not worry so much about balancing at the moment. FIX THESE CRASHES FIRST. RESPECT YOUR CUSTOMERS ENOUGH TO NOT RELEASE SOMETHING THAT WILL DESTROY THEIR PC'S.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000166299', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 8979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4024, 'playtime_at_review': 2556, 'last_played': 1736771775}
review:
This is more a review on how Early Access feels to play rather than the game itself.

I very much disagree with the way changes are happening, the campaign is LONG and it is a significant time investment to get through it. That in itself isn't necessarily a problem just yet since leagues aren't a thing, but GGG has been extremely trigger-happy to push hotfixes that just instantly brick your entire build. 

I wake up on a random thursday morning to find my build that I spent all my resources and like 30+ hours on to not just be nerfed, but to be made entirely unplayable.. Okay, it is early access so changes are expected, but my major issue stems from the fact that re-speccing costs a SCALING amount of gold meaning that I cannot fix my deleted build. This would mean that my only options are to A) grind gold with a build that does not function any longer or B) completely start over with a new character and no guarantee that the exact same thing won't happen to the new build.

Meanwhile a lot of the QoL issues take so much longer to get any attention, it makes for a fairly frustrating experience, in my opinion re-speccing should be totally free in early access so you can adapt to these rapid-fire, extreme changes, because I personally can't be bothered to play more if every character I pump time and effort into is at risk of being disabled while I'm given absolutely no tools to recover.

I'll change this review later as these are the very early days of course, but this is disheartening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198415826350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 22731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11266, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1736723145}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047467168', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 549, 'playtime_at_review': 8203, 'last_played': 1736847557}
review:
Overall, it's a massive step forward for the aRPG genre: slowing down the zooming, adding interesting boss mechanics, and introducing cross-skill and elemental interactions.

While there is nothing that even closely matches PoE2 in quality, I unfortunately cannot recommend it to everyone. Early Access is still Early Access and comes with all the standard issues you’d expect: occasional crashes, lack of optimization, and annoying — sometimes even game-breaking — bugs.

Sadly, GGG prioritizes class/skill balances over actual fundamental improvements (to be fair, likely because of the complexity of the latter). So, unless you’re keen to invest your time to watch the game grow, actively report bugs, and lower your quality expectations overall, it’s better to stay away for a couple of months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028057675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1734098342}
review:
gave this a real shot, but atm i would not recommend this unfinished mess to anybody.

character movement is slow as hell while enemies can run right to you before you can cast a spell, whcih also punishes the use of fancy combos you could pull of (put down wall of flame and then shoot projectiles through it to empower those, but enemies are already behind the wall even before i finished casting it)

bosses regualrly have attacks that just one or two shot you, which would be somewhat ok when the hotboxes of the attacks were consistent with the animations.

some bosses will regularly swarm you with enemies and trap you and because of the inflatet hp pool of even the most trash mobs of trash mobs you cannot "just kill them" easily.

My guess would be that some builds work better then others, but the steep gold costs of repeccing totally kill any experimentation somebody could do.

Will look back in a year if it gets better but untill then I'll rather play poe1 or d4 (it's sad to say that I think d4 is more fun then poe2, beacause i had so high expectations for this game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002843186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 12577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 630, 'playtime_at_review': 3485, 'last_played': 1736802309}
review: Stop bricking people's builds while half of the skills and passive nodes don't even work correctly

author: {'steamid': '76561198037218058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 43, 'playtime_at_review': 5048, 'last_played': 1735768707}
review:
The overwhelming majority of PoE2 is excellent. Some of the content is a little rough around the edges, as you might expect in Early Access.

However, a fundamental axis of character power (Ascendancy) is currently blocked behind oppressive random mechanics that are outside the fundamental gameplay loop. For this reason alone, I cannot recommend the game - it's that bad. I am eager to change my review to "recommended" if they rework the Ascendancy system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049590411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13011, 'playtime_at_review': 19582, 'last_played': 1736846533}
review:
The game does not respect your time. 

All maps are too large. All maps are too nonlinear. This was fixed in games back in the 90s. The figured ways to cleverly not have us spend most of our time backtracking with various methods. But making the maps "linear" while appearing nonlinear is the best way to do it. GGG has the money. Now please fix it. D4 fixed it. Dont make the same mistakes D4 does - it is a bad omen. All maps and in particular all campaign maps needs to be reduced in size by atleast 60%. All of the monsters can still be here. 

The campagin is too long. Respeccing is too expensive. You dont get enough skill gems to try out the skills like they want us to during "early access". Testing a character takes way too long too. Just running through the entire campaign takes so many hours. A 3h run is an extremely far fetched prospect. We are talking 10++++++. Probably 30 for new players. Maybe more. Relative monster level for the difficulty is too low which also makes levelling too slow. Level 79 monsters is the highest average from T15 which makes levelling up an absolute chore. T16 maps is extremely rare. Its basically the divine orb drops from POE1. 

All corridors and doors are too small. They are not wide enough for minions or projectiles to walk through and many builds have to facecheck things. I notice they removed almost all open maps as well. Really? This needs to be addressed. Visibility is already a problem in this game. 

Visibility is a huge issue in the game. Layering is all wrong. Walls covers so we cannot see things. We cannot see the nodes on the atlas because they arent on the top layer. They are covered. Spell effects cover the entire scree so we cannot see anything. Ground effects and ondeath effects cannot be seen due to the visual clutter you added to the game. Best example is probably the chimaera in chimera wetlands where the poison ground is basically impossible to see due to the beautful leaves and flowers on the ground... THAT ARE ABOVE THE POISONOUS GROUND MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO SEE. And this is a continous problem through the entire game. Important visual or audio queues and simply dug down into the grave GGG dug for us and they buried us with it.  Wth guys. This is a serious flaw in a punishing and difficult game. Dying from something we didnt even see or hear. This MUST be fixed. 

Difficulty scaling in POE2 is something like archnemesis from POE1. You randomly encounter a mob that is just extremely fast, spawns on top of you and is faster than you and stuns you. Predicting difficulty of a map, monster or boss is impossible. 

You get only 1 try at maps and bosses and lose your entire investment and all juice on the map node. Terrible design. Especially for new players who basically needs to outgear all bosses so much that they oneshot them with one of the exploit builds to progress through the game.

RIght now the ascendancies are a joke. The game is like Gratz you got level 20! Lets go to sanctum! The funnest league mechanic and die for a few hours. New players, seemingly fall for this evil trick by the game, thinking ascendancies arent so bad. But oh no - you are FORCED to play ultimatum or sanctum which are basically roguelikes but reversed - the best thing about roguelikes is simply misunderstood during implementation. Here you just get weaker. 

Stun threshhold and ailment immunity is not possible to get in this game. A juiced monster can often run up to you and smack you in the face or hit you with arbitrary large aoes that ramps up chill or stuns you and you are poof gone. This cannot be prevented in any way apart from a short immunity with a charm. New players will only have one however and probably not know which one they need at any given time and will just inevitably die without being able to control their character. This is bad design. 

All maps need to get the boss back or we need way to consistently run bosses. Do whichever of this GGG. But right now the boss nodes are the only good ones in maps. While bossing you need a good single target build and ranged class. They are infinitely better and more flexible with position while dealing 100% dps. Melee are melee. Shafted. During mapping we want to zoom. 

All on death effects needs to be removed from the game. What were you thinking? Why can you not challenge us while the monsters are up instead of when they are defeated? Are you so bad that they all have to carry a mine in a different weird colour to try to catch us off gueard? Is that the only way you can challenge us? Force us to farm for 16 hours to get a citadel, but hopefully atleast once catch us blinking or off guard for just a moment and have us die from an almost invisible ground effect or death effect so we lose the entire and only T16 map we had? As well as a big chunk of experience. And the juice permanently removed from the atlas node. Like who designed this? What is the intent behind the decision? 

Minion AI is some of the worst in gaming history. Age of Empires 1 had better AI for movement and pathing for AI controlled units.

Magic Find stats on gear is some of the worst implementations of magic find in the history of gaming. It gives so much that it more than tripples your loot. WIthout it, you are just floundering around getting nothing. You do not have to choices. I play T45 maps and you are stuck farming T15s. That is the difference. You can choose to not play MF and simply not get anything. MF is just like Gacha Games. You can choose to add the sugar back into the game if you just drink from the poison vial. Go ahead. 

Trading in this game is a terrible implentation as well. The entire systems needs remake. 

The atlas needs a complete remake. The towers and hideouts are just griefing us with no reward. I cannot for the life of me find more than a single citadel every 80 hours played. 

Ground effects are the real danger. The bosses are wet noodles. The bosses needs to be more challenging. The maps standard monstes should be swathes of monsters I just brainlessly zerg down. Why? Because standing on your toes squinting and concentrating for 12h+ is not feasible. And this is what is required for this game that does not respect our time. A race takes too long. Levelling takes too long. FInding a citadel takes too long. Trading takes too long. Finding even a single jewellers orb takes too long. If we are to spend so many hours, we must be able to spend most of it brainless. Mindnless. But I want a boss in each map. So that when we get to it it is full focus. Full squint and fivehead. Difficult challenge. And rewarded for it. That is what I want to see from POE2. POE1 zoom through map. All death effects gone from monsters. Archnemesis removed. All negative map effects reduced and difficulty based on tier and MF ON MAP NOT GEAR.

These are just a couple of issues off the top of my head. I'm just tired from writing. This poor excuse for an early access release is really bad and needs to be addressed hard. There is so much to do before what I think will become the game of the year gets its chance. But right now there are so many issues that it is PAINFUL to play the game. You get so punished for so many thing and end up spending HUNDREDS of hours just to test things because they do not respect our time. Its like they dont want us to test their game with such long campaign, such long levell up times, such expensive respecs, such low droprates on waystones and no ascendancy respec. Really GGG. I am so damn dissapointed in you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353080142', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1734010759}
review:
Very solid game. Buy the game in its current early access state if you love wasting time. 
The recent nerf to classes as well as the 'Comet Build' many such as myself have been investing time into, has been nerfed to the ground. This wouldn't be a problem if the developers gave us free respec points however they have not. Meaning if you've invested hours upon hours in a now useless build you'll have to stop progression and spend more hours for gold, resources and gear just to respec into another build that will most likely be nerfed in a later patch. 
If resetting skill points was free- especially in early access, it would help a lot with many peoples frustrations. 
Will update review if the developers learn common sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026838283', 'num_games_owned': 1528, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1733611817}
review: The game receives positive reviews from [strike]tourists[/strike] people unfamiliar with the original game. However, they forget one important thing: it's not a one-and-done type of game, it's a live service game. And so far I'm yet to find a single person saying they will play this again 3 times a year for the next 10 years, which is what we did in the first one. I've been playing Path of Exile since 2013, haven't missed a single league since 2015 (that's 32 three-month-long leagues). Campaign was a tiny part of it, a chore we had to do to access new content. Well, Path of Exile 2's campaign is THE chore. You have no loot, you traverse giant maps with no (real) movement skill, and you fight an endless stream of monsters that can all kill you in a couple of hits. And if you happen to die, the endless stream of monsters respawns so you have to do it again. The bosses are giant sponges that take forever to kill, unless your build is good enough. But you can't change your build because respec cost far exceeds the amount of currency you receive. So your only option is to grind lower difficulty zones, to get enough materials to craft something. But like, for what purpose? The end game appears to be just as bad. There are far better games that respect your time, that are fun to play. Funnily enough, even the first Path of Exile, also a time sink but at least it's rewarding. At least until they kill it to focus on this slop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028457536', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2147, 'deck_playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1733977734}
review:
I've only dabbled in a few ARPGs, mainly Diablo 3, Last Epoch, and Minecraft Dungeons so I'm not sure if my opinion will be helpful... But this game is not in a good state. I really like what they're going for here with the world and mechanics(heck, I even stopped to read the lore), but a lot of gripes start piling up when I hit Act 2 and get amplified when I reach the tail-end of Act 3. 

When you start the ascendency trials in Act 2, you really understand how much the devs hate melee. You get this resource called "honor" which acts as a new health bar throughout the trial. Now, I'm playing as a monk, so I'm forced to keep throwing ranged spells at enemies or risk losing honor because every enemy is so fast and you're too slow. I was barely able finish the first ascendency trial, and while I enjoy the roguelike mechanics, I do not want to deal with that trial again just to get more ascendency points.

My second major gripe is with respawning. When you die, you'll respawn at the nearest checkpoint. Sounds good so far. But the problem is every time you die, all the enemies come back. They don't just come back either, they get randomized. It's very frustrating having to clear out waves and waves of enemies, only to die to enemies rushing and surrounding you, only to respawn and die because a rare mob spawned right next to the checkpoint. I understand if they wanted it so you're always getting exp... but just let me grind on my own time. I don't want to deal with the same packs of mobs again and again and again. It got so bad in Act 3 that I just wanted to rush through all the mobs and get to the next checkpoint or area. A simple fix would be to keep the current status of the map, but heal the mobs back to full so you can try again.

GGG also keeps nerfing builds people are spending a lot of time on, and the only way to respec builds is by using gold. When you level up, the respec build costs also increase. So when you invest 50+ hours into a specific build, it could all go to waste because GGG decided that build was too fun and needed to be nerfed. I just don't feel the need to keep playing when at any point GGG can decide the way I'm playing is wrong. At the very least during Early Access, respecs should be free.

Next issue is a bit subjective, but the difficulty is way too imbalanced. Some bosses are far too easy to kill, and some bosses are Jamanra. Jamanra not only has a ridiculously high health pool compared to the Act 1 final boss, but he has a total of around 13 moves that he uses across both phases. That is the very definition of over-designed. Basic mobs also feel way too spongey. They constantly like to rush and surround you. Without any good movement skills, most deaths feel insanely cheap and maps feel like a slog to get through.

At this point I think I'm done with the game. I'll see in about 2-3 months if things change, and I'll update the review if they do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005260265', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 14556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2915, 'playtime_at_review': 5694, 'last_played': 1736846157}
review:
The main issues with the game are as listed:

Trials: Remove the honor system and they'll be fine. Let us purchase the means to enter the trials.
One-shot/After-Death mechanics of enemies: Either nerf the damage or get rid of it entirely.
XP Loss on death: Why? Just get rid of it. We die so many times to unseen/offscreen stuff that it gets frustrating grinding back up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999918463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1734132039}
review: no loot, mobs scale faster than your character does. all they did was create a standalone client for ruthless mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047769935', 'num_games_owned': 1205, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1734187762}
review:
I'm just so tired.
I'm tired of being oneshot.
I'm tired of trash mobs being so tanky that fighting them turns into tedium.
I'm tired of no loot, no excitement, *negative* feeling of getting stronger, the obscenely large maps with the player character moving so, so slowly.
I'm tired of being expected to do a dark souls boss fight every twenty minutes with arpg controls and absolutely no rewards except advancing another fetch quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108332520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3567, 'last_played': 1734318405}
review:
Regular mobs with insta-kill attacks,  after-death insta-kill explosions and insta-kill traps. I'm just too old for this nonsense. 

If you liked POE1 and Diablo 3 & 4 you might not like this game. The thing is I DON'T want to play Souls when I play an ARPG.  

Time will tell if I'm in the minority.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996266260', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1506, 'last_played': 1733959159}
review:
Nerfing builds during EA is understandable. 

Nerfing them to the ground without enabling us to respec for a fraction of the cost is NOT understandable. Respect my time, devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028953943', 'num_games_owned': 1572, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 5410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2564, 'last_played': 1734892544}
review: They keep nerfing every interesting build with no way to respec without playing over 10 hrs worth of straight up farming gold. Go fuck yourself

author: {'steamid': '76561197962897033', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 3360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3360, 'last_played': 1734924546}
review:
Curently, it's a no. The game is super fun. This is what ARPG "Diablo" style should play like. Far exceeds Diablo 4 attempt at an aRPG. 

The reason for the No. 

All the crashing. 

Crash to desktop - randomly

Computer freezes up and you have to reboot it. Maybe it's 24h2 update, maybe it's 9800x3d. Either way, the game should not be crashing let alone having crash in a way you have to physically reboot the pc via the restart or power button. I have seen that Win10 does not have the hard crash where you have to reboot manually. Still doesn't matter though, the game should not be crashing... 

Until I can play the game without a crash, it'll be a No. 

I'll play it again when it releases and maybe before. If I can play without crashing i'll update my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198883959677', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9786, 'playtime_at_review': 4831, 'last_played': 1736846958}
review: I love the game the first 3 acts were great and I had fun going through the campaign BUT I hate how you have one try in a waystone then you have to start over and to make it worst when you play with a Friend if he die then they cant go back in the map and same goes with host too. It just brakes the co op experience and makes it not fun. having more  life for both would be much better then just one for both. For the trials I don't like them mostly because of the honor system and the horrendous RNG that can just brick your run. playing melee makes it 10 times worse to. Having to go through all three boss again ever time you do a new trial even though you already fought the last bosses for the ascendancy point just really sucks. I know some people will just say get good but just because it's hard doesn't mean it's fun to  play and i don't  have fun when i do the trials nor the co op on how it is now.  PLZ GGG just want to enjoy your endgame. I HAVE 800+ hours in poe 1 and love that game and i love poe 2 but as it stands now the endgame not it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965318189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1834, 'last_played': 1735198695}
review:
I want to say this is a great ARPG because of how great the combat looks and feels. However, I can't really tell someone they should play it because of one major issue: the loot. Every aspect of the game is littered with casino elements. Progress in every direction is predicated on taking an item using a rare orb to add a random extra effect of random intensity. Every step is based on RNG. 
Example of the joys getting the gear you need: have an item you think is the best thing you have found thus far? Use a vaal orb for a chance at another stat on it! Oh wow, every single stat you previously rolled has now been changed and the item is utter trash. It's corrupted now and you can't change anything about it. The end. 

TLDR, game's combat is great, but progress is gated behind casino logic and huge time investments. You need to no life or get a gambling addiction to truly enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047725017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 20094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6288, 'playtime_at_review': 7136, 'last_played': 1736784142}
review: Okay, I put $60 in this game and I love this game. I hate the end game. GGG punishes you for logging in because you get on play to play for 30 mins and be worse off than when you logged in. It could take you an hour of farming to get back the 30 mins of time you lost, that's if you don't die again. Which means you lost 1.5 hours of game play in 30 mins just to get back to where you started from. You lose xp on death. You lose the waystone that you spent to open the portal and you lose the node that you spent resources to open like dimensions. This game gives you 1 step forward for winning and 5 steps back for losing. Please, ggg, stop punishing us for playing your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077451879', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 4664, 'deck_playtime_at_review': 4347, 'last_played': 1735683080}
review:
Poe2 is in the worst state it will ever be in, out of Early Access I have no doubt things will be better then they currently are. I still have some concerns for certain systems though. 

- Melee

Playing Melee is for people who want the most challenge...

    1. Melee has way too much wind up in most cases making you over commit to attacks often leading to you dying, while on Merc for example you can move at full speed while shooting making most boss encounters a joke. None of Dmg resist scaling make much of a difference in the late game. So when you do get hit you will die regardless of how hard you spec into defense.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Melee as always been something GGG have been massively changing though out all of Poe. Maybe they could make certain attacks have faster animations or give you a Large dmg negation while attacking. Something to give more of a window to attack. 

    2. On MnK Melee often will lock on an enemy your not trying to attack, when trying to slam a specific area to hit the most enemies or trying to attack your bell your character will just attack the enemy closest to your cursor. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An option to remove the lock-on and make it so you just melee in the direction of your cursor for skills you want on the skills screen would be a good change.

 
- Support Sockets

Compared to poe1 the implementation of support gems here is a massive improvement but GGG decided to lock it away through too many hoops in my opinnion...

1. Having 3 Different currencies to expand your support sockets that are more and more rare or having to gamble with Vaal Orbs makes using a Key Feature in your game so much harder to fully utilize. Also note that these are tied to the skill gem itself and not the slot and there are going to be double the amount of skills there are now when out of early access.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Maybe Allow uncut skill gems that drop have a chance to have 3 – 5 links already on it making them more exciting drop even in the endgame or instead of 3 types of Jeweller's Orbs just make 2 types; Normal Jeweller's Orb that drops as much as Regal Orbs and Perfect Jeweller's Orb with slightly better drop rate then it is currently. Normal will give you up to 4 sockets and Perfect will give you the final 5th slot.

- Passive Tree

Poe1 wasn't afraid to give power, in the sequel however they are very careful with power, to the point of making build variety shrink. (like always going for Giant’s Blood on Warrior)

1. Navigation of the passive tree is a lot more brutal this time around. Your a lot more keen to make a mistake and having to repec more often on this passive tree. Everything is alot more scattered in most cases.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Make passive highways have slightly less nodes so you can get around the tree. Allow us to go further in the passive tree to make more build varieties.

2. Many Passives have a negative effect compared to poe1. In my opinion this shouldn’t exist outside of Keystones but now its spread throughout the tree which I don’t like.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Pls Rebalance GGG and have less Negative effects outside of keystones. 

Side note --- Game doesn’t run well on Steam Deck

author: {'steamid': '76561197991879192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2894, 'last_played': 1734900374}
review:
On release day i listened to a podcast where Jonathan spoke about how much they've played and enjoyed their game before EA, and that he found POE 1 unplayable after spending so much time in POE 2.

And they still had to nerf a basic build enabling skill by 95% within the first week, bricking thousands of characters. Did no one in the inhouse testing or closed beta try a CoF sorc? Was this really a surprise to you? 

Man did i get bamboozled by the devs "open", "honest" and "humble" attitude towards the playerbase. I've never had any game devs disrespect my time spent this much before. Absolute clown show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028375998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3555, 'last_played': 1735062098}
review:
Right now I can NOT recomend this game because of the following reasons:
- "Perfectly dodge or die in one hit" is not fun
- Very scarse loot (expecially currency, so not a lot of crafting) is not fun
- Am I just unlucky or is it normal to find 80% loot for OTHER classes and not for the one I'm playing?
- Low mobility + every fight is a souls-like one + huge map = not fun (you need to invest a lot of time)
- Rare (yellow) chests dropping 1 magic item and few gold coins
- Rare (yellow) monsters dropping 2 magic items, a normal item and few gold coins
- To level a gem you need an item (uncut gem, no exp needed) = your power is at the mercy of the loot system
- [1st edit] Monsters' chaos damage is totaly out of control (and finding chaos resist on items is pretty much impossible)
- [1st edit] Sometimes the screen is so full of effects (expecially during big boss fights) that it's impossible to understay how/why I died
- [1st edit] I have tens of good base/magic items to craft into rares but no crafting currency AT ALL
- [1st edit] I have plenty of runes but no orbs to create sockets
- [1st edit] All monsters respawn when you die + big maps = exploration is a pain (expecially when you die in 1 sec and you do not know what killed you)

I'll gladly change my review in the future but for now "it is what it is".

author: {'steamid': '76561198016216375', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5694, 'last_played': 1735414899}
review:
Challenge is good, difficulty is good....  in games that are not based on RNG.  When every single thing is based  on RNG…from coins,ultimatum things to find so you can even attempt the trials for ascendancy points, curses on trials, loot, “crafting”, rare enemy mods....  and then you try to mix dodge rolling and challenging gameplay with it then it simply  falls apart.  Visuality on maps using a lot of spells is not built for tactical dodges and all that.
There is no desire to overcome a hard foe cause there is no exploration after it. Because it is just a random generated layout. 
Cause there is no fixed loot, cause killing the boss is just pulling a lever on a slot machine. 
And that loot that drops most cases is useless. What unique things do you find? Yeah that's barely usable and a rare item is usually better.
All mixed together and the game loses the meaning of challenging and becomes punishing for the sake of being punishing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974926968', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10230, 'last_played': 1734892790}
review:
In mapping so it is review time!

The good:
* Campaign - top notch! Note: only 3 Acts available in Early Access
* Graphics - improved over PoE1 which is to be expected
* Sound design - took me by suprise and is quite good for the genre
* Soundtrack - improved over PoE1 by large margins - boss fights having their own music is great
* Dark Souls inspired combat - some love it / some hate it
* Loot is more simplified from PoE1
* Less currency bloat from PoE1

The bad:
* Crafting - heavily nerfed from Path of Exile 1 as it allows for very little control - you can brick an item that is blue quality and it feels awful
* Dark Souls inspired combat - some love it / some hate it
* Maps bricked after 1 death - teammates can't even revive anyone when mapping together
* You will often find early game loot is vastly superior to late game loot due to poor RNG on stat rolls
* You cannot replace runes already placed in sockets 

The ugly:
* Streamer / degenerate bait
* Stay away if you have bad RNG in games
* If you do play it, I hope you are ready to play it like it's a job.

Maybe in the future, I will change the status of my review. As it stands, this game is streamer / degenerate bait. The hope is the game will improve and maybe a return will be warranted. Right now though, this game is very unfriendly to newcomers to the genre and casuals alike. If this is the desired direction GGG is going to take, the only population left will be streamers and degenerates within a year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023855445', 'num_games_owned': 1101, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 6871, 'last_played': 1735813741}
review:
TL;DR: Game is currently not good enough to be played over it's predecessor. Early Access is not an excuse for clearly intentional unfun systems.

The maps are a slog to go through, you're most likely going to think it's not that big of a deal but it really is. I have done the campaign with 3 characters and it was honestly the most painful experience I got from an ARPG campaign. 
It wasn't hard, the difficulty isn't the problem to begin with, you're simply always on the edge of being killed so you have to be careful of EVERYTHING and play slowly constantly while spamming dodge roll.
No, the pain came from how long each map take to clear/go through. The maps are immense and you have no movement skill. If you have to full clear a map because you missed a corner you probably spent 25-50 minutes here.
It wouldn't be so awful if the maps had league mechanics to do, sadly it is not the case, it's only trash mobs taking ages to die while being able to two-hit kill you or very rarely an optional boss that gives nothing.

The bosses are cool, I'll give the game that. The designs, animations, patterns are very well done and it is a blast to kill them but those encounters also got a big problem, they were designed to require you to use the dodge roll constantly.
Again you might think it's normal to make the player use a tool for those fights, yes it is, but not when half the moves of the boss one shot you if you miss a dodge no matter your build.
Please understand that later on in the Atlas the maps are "one time use", if you die you lose your materials, 10% experience and your time. When you lose a big chunk of the investment you made because you missed ONE roll, I wouldn't call it hard but unfair. Even Souls have very few moves being able to one tap you while you're built to be tanky.

The gem system is very restricting but also very clear for new players. It was said during an interview that even they don't know the combos the players can make but that's a lie.
The gems are all locked to a weapon, which reduce the combo possibilities already.
Worse than that, instead of making support gems work with both attacks and spells they made distinctions. This kills the amount of potential synergies available. To me they restricted those uses because they wanted to narrow down gem combos and have an easier time balancing.

The loot was VERY bad the first few days but now with the buffs it's tolerable, at least when you go through the campaign you can find an upgrade every few hours now. But you are hardly feeling like you earned the loot through hard work, you're more feeling like "FINALLY a new piece of gear that isn't garbage". In endgame with juiced content and Magic Find the loot is similar to PoE1.

Magic Find is basically mandatory if you want to feel like you're progressing. Without it you are dropping a lot less currency and the economy is already fucked because of it. Either join them or don't buy any good item. It restricts the builds to a select few, it isn't fun.

I really want to like the game but it's not doing itself any favours. I don't want to think about how bad it would be to go through so many hours of campaign every league. In fact I probably would only make one character per league, if I even bother.
The game is currently not fun because you have to be on edge constantly, the punishment for a mistake like mistiming your dodge roll is too high even against trash mobs and the loot doesn't feel rewarding either. Armour is dogshit, the passive tree is promoting Energy Shield gameplay.

Go play PoE1 and enable Ruthless, it's the same experience and no one liked it.

A lot of the good reviews are from people that are either still on the hype high, not in endgame yet or with too little playtime for now to experience the problems that will come down the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199914686', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1734197645}
review: Unfortunately, the game has critical technical flaws. Specifically, on my version of Windows 2h24, the game frequently freezes my computer during level loading due to CPU usage spiking to 100%. This issue can only be resolved with a hard reboot. The latest patches for the game have not addressed this problem, making it technically impossible for me to continue playing, as on average, every hour of gameplay results in a computer freeze.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970533242', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3447, 'last_played': 1735333648}
review:
A mile wide and about 3 inches deep, there's a lot to love, it's beautiful, the campaign acts are fantastic, but the new ascendancy system is tied to the honor a POE1 trial mechanic that was bad then and is worse now.  Trade is a joke, as it was/is in POE 1 except for China.  It just feels like a lot of the same pitfalls of the first game they were trying to get away from and then just kind of ran out of ideas but needed to make a deadline.  
  
Unfortunately this game is so complex that it's doomed to be tweaked endlessly and will ultimately end up just like POE1 with the power creep to compensate the complexity and balance.  There's already many nonviable build types, and basically entire skills that are just kinda "there" to fill some space right now.
  
It's like they went to the POE 1 buffet and picked all the worst elements and put them in a new engine and gave up after act 3 on innovation.  There's some great ideas, there's some beautiful atmosphere, good writing, but???? you know?

author: {'steamid': '76561198051922373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4975, 'last_played': 1734844793}
review:
While the game may be fun for the first several hours, it's problems rear their ugly heads quite quickly.

It tries too hard to be D2's successor but does nothing to improve upon it or PoE, for that matter. The game becomes increasingly repetitive and punishing and, to be quite honest, a slog. Classes are undercooked, itemization is non-existent, uniques are utter and complete trash. Passive skill tree is incredibly lazily designed. Drop rates were buffed, but still nowhere near as useful as currency remains scarce, so crafting is out the window. If you're not SSF you're better off trading for gear than finding it yourself.

Dodge rolling may be fun at first but quickly becomes annoying. The issue there is because, while the player has been nerfed to the ground and is playing PoE2, the monsters and their modifiers and abilities come straight from PoE1, good luck keeping your distance or staying alive from projectiles flying your way from outside your screen. 

GGG promised a 50 hour campaign. That might sound cool at first, until you realise the campaign is about 5 hour long, cause their storytelling is incredibly subpar, wrapped up in a 50 hour fat suit of mindless trudging through awkwardly big maps that are designed to make you pull your hair out. During the endgame, you really need to focus on only one type of it if you really want something out of it. So much for the "quantity of endgame activities".

Overall, for what was promised by GGG, and for how much GGG's stoic defenders shat on D4 at it's release and still do, PoE2 has the same problems and many more. But people won't say anything bad about them even though they've had 12 years of experience with nearly the exact same team behind it. And for people saying this is just EA and it's to be expected - yes, it's early access, not a beta. You paid money to test a game that shouldn't be in the public eye for at least another 2 years. 

This game is quickly losing it's shine and people will soon figure out how tiresome it is to play it and move on. Not worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069661795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1735521340}
review:
I know the game is on early acess but holy crap, is the performance bad, and I've got a very beefy PC. From what the PC resource monitor could gather, the game has an issue allocating processing power to the GPU and pretty much the CPU does all the work. I've tried going with the graphics all the way up as some help forums recommended me, to force the Game to send the workload to the GPU, but it still doesnt work. The Game/Engine has a difficult time making the GPU work. The game performance is just extremely awful for this simple reason.
Game is fun and all, but I can't recommend it to anyone right now until they figure it out how to fix this. SPECIALLY if you're in a country without localized prices like me, and the game costs a LOT of money. Like, A LOT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029683449', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 208, 'playtime_at_review': 4356, 'last_played': 1736563603}
review:
A December update broke the game for me.
During loading screens my PC freezes 9/10 times and I need to reboot.
BIOS and all drivers up to date.
There is a temporary fix that may work for some, not for me.
It involves running the game with certain cores disables or without multithreading at all (enjoy those 30 fps!).
I can only prevent the game from freezing by disabling multithreading from the in-game options.
Game runs poorly now, even on my 4080. 15-25 fps in hubs, around 40-60 fps in combat zones.
Love the game heaps, but can't recommend as of now.
Will update this review when it's fixed.
If you don't run into problems, the game's a solid 10/10 for ARPG lovers who like a challenge.

*UPDATE* December 29
Nothing has changed. Sometimes I can manually disable cores and play for a couple of hours. Other times it keeps freezing indefinitely upon firing up the game and I have to stop and try again later. Very unnerving.

*UPDATE* January 7
Still no fix. Someone on the forums here said GGG have been on hiatus these past two weeks and aren't working on a fix, yet. Can't really comment on that.
I spent roughly 30 hours with 3-10 freezes per gaming sesh before I lost my patience. Will come back to the game when they've fixed multithreading and it doesn't freeze/crash no more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987831277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 27210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8637, 'playtime_at_review': 21546, 'last_played': 1736830506}
review:
POE 2 is currently in a strange spot with Early Access. While the game has many many fun and high points, the lows and frustrations are also incredibly rampant.

Pros: 
- Great visuals, plenty of uniques from PoE1 were reintroduced in POE2 but with a new visual update and they look absolutely amazing.
- Game runs much smoother than its predecessor 
- The campaign is good and quite fun to play, despite there being only 3 acts of story. (You redo the 3 acts in a higher difficulty, GGG will add more acts as time goes on)
- Boss fights. Oh my god did they ever do such an amazing job with the boss fights. The fights are meant to be longer than what you are used to in POE 1. Every boss has its own special mechanic or unique set of abilities that define them. While some builds just evaporate the bosses, you lose a lot of the fun and what makes this game so great in the complexity of these bosses. 
- Better than D4

Cons:

- The large maps with low movement speed and lack of movement abilities, the only good movement ability is blink but has quite a high cooldown and most classes will never use it. Other movement abilities (dodge roll, shield charge, leap slam) All have strange collision which can lead to many many unfortunate things happening as you don't always roll/charge/leap the direction you want monsters can effectively create a wall causing you to roll along them instead of through.

- Passive tree. The tree is big but it feels incredibly empty, a lot of the passive points you are using end up being used to travel from one side of the tree to another. The tree also favours heavily into lightning damage and spell casters which limits a lot of builds

- Builds. While poe.ninja does not yet exist for POE2, the majority of players have about 1-3 builds to really pick from if they want to experience all of POE2's endgame. With the passive tree heavily leaning towards energy shield and lightning damage, the majority of players are forced to take that path or be extremely limited in progression of your atlas.

- Ascending. There are four ascensions you can do for your character to increase their strength. The first two ascensions are a challenge but not impossibel to d

- Crafting. If you've played POE1 you know that crafting is one of the core components in the game and it also attributes to a lot of its fun. What GGG has done to crafting in poe2 is more of a gamble than actually crafting. With the removal of deterministic crafting, to get any good gear now you sort of have to pray you get lucky with your exalt slams. Access to crafting materials is very gated, whether it be very hard to find the materials you are looking for, or you are just simply too poor to afford omens/greater essences/distilled emotions.

- The Atlas. While the introduction of the atlas seemed really cool and interesting at first, it has some problems of its own. I was not able to find a Citadel for the first 100 hours or so I spent mapping, you need to find three separate citadels before you can challenge the pinnacle boss. Your atlas is generated via a seed that is locked to your account, so if you were to get an unlucky seed or head off in the wrong direction it takes a while. There are players who reported to not finding a citadel after days of just mapping.
There has been a report of a player's atlas who was bugged and he could not progress further.
If you were to move far enough away and try to back pedal in another direction on your atlas, parts of it will not load. To remedy that you're forced to do a map near that area to force the next area to visually load on your screen. Towers  were introduced as a form of "juicing" your maps but they feel like the sextants from poe1 but on crack. Sextants were removed from POE1 two leagues ago, adding them back in the form of towers seems like a strange process to me. 

- Mapping. GGG took a new approach to endgame mapping now with nodes that you travel across an atlas, similar to navigating a passive tree. What they didn't tell the playerbase was that maps are now only 1 try per map. If you die you lose your waystone, map, the potential loot/exp and 10% exp. With 1 portal being what seems to be the new norm, players are then again forced to either play incredibly safe or play one of the few meta builds that kills everything really fast while being just as tanky.

- Monster packs and on-death effects. While GGG updated visuals for the game and scenery looks amazing. The lack of distinction between a normal/magic/rare monster is quite concerning. In POE1 they were identified easily by a blue hue around them for magic and a yellow hue around them for rare. 
 I am not sure why GGG has decided to give almost every other monster pack some form of on-death effect. Whether they drop a pool of damage that does DoT while you stand on it, or they just explode it has become 
one of the most infuriating things that a majority of the player base die to. 

- Pinnacle bosses and map mechanics. While the new atlas tree looks spectacular and I like what they did with it. Accessibility to other trees is near impossible without a lot of time dedication or you spend the ingame currency to buy access to it. I've clocked about 350 hours and I have no points in 3 of 5 of the mechanics. With such limited access to these pinnacle bosses and with only one chance to get the fight right. Players are then forced to either look for someone to carry or play one of the meta builds in order to beat said boss.

- GGG going radio silent. While I understand it is the holidays and that people deserve to be with their families and loved ones during that time. I do not agree with shipping a new early access product, supporting it for 2 weeks and then complete silence for the following 2. While this may have worked with leagues in POE1 it was because the game was in a stable spot and any fixes that were required were addressed fairly easily. 

Summary:
The game is fun and has a lot potential for growth, but currently I would not recommend the game for someone looking to get into aRPGs. I would suggest waiting another couple of months for a big update on the game before revisiting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287134988', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1734114792}
review: Nope, not my type of game. After playing diablo for approximately 140 hours, this game felt a bit dull. It can easily be seen that odd choices were made in the game's development stage. To illustrate that, why would we need to use dodge-roll mechanic in an obligatory way? Witch should have been able to teleport to locations instead of rolling on the ground as if its clothes are on fire. Skills gems, on the other hand, why do i have to carry the gems all around with me if I want to use another sword or crossbow etc. Developers should have made this game easier than the previous one. I've played PoE1 and i can clearly say that PoE2 has achieved great things. However, it can be better than the current state. Skill Gems must be removed as well as support gems. They can add some type of skill tree for both of them since it is just meaningless in terms of carrying all the skills that we have in inventory or in stash. Other than that game is great so far but this led me to refund it unfortunately. I don't want to use my ability to think when playing this type of games. Why would i have to think about what skill gem should i take with me and what to put in stash. I just want to kill some monsters without any concern. Diablo 4 made this perfectly. I am not trying to compare these two games though, I'm just trying to tell you that this game can make things simple yet they chose to make it complex.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032860184', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1734930991}
review:
I cannot currently give anyone a recommendation to get this game in early access. I understand early access games come with its own sleuth of issues as the game tends to be not fully ironed out compared to a full release. Heck, even full release games are buggy sometimes.

But there's bugs and there's the game just refusing to let you play it. Currently there has no word of any fixes. The game can hard crash your PC at any point from between first loading the game or even loading into new areas or the towns. Your PC stalls and you have no way to recover other than hard reset your PC (holding the power button). Absolutely horrible especially when you are paying for early access but you can barely access it.

You can go to the forums and try your hand on the 5 million things people think have resolved their issues but I feel like I don't have to be forced to go out of my way to get something as basic as accessing the product I paid for. Plus, all these "resolutions" seem to only last like a week. And no, I will not install a different OS or downgrade to an older version of windows 11. 

Please GGG, let me play the game. PLEASE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002407253', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 24516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7198, 'playtime_at_review': 4700, 'last_played': 1736835067}
review:
games in a rough spot. campaign is overall good, but can be easy or hard depending on your RNG for loot. 

Ascending is a chore, especially the 3rd and 4th one. Maps are overtuned, no crafting, difficult to improve character power, boring endgame.

White mobs can be harder than rare mobs...white mobs can also chunk you for 50% or just kill you. Defensive layers do not matter.
