author: {'steamid': '76561198284021524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19571, 'last_played': 1733228275}
review: Despite the frankly terrible state of the game at launch, this game still had a great story and setting just waiting to be matched by the lackluster gameplay. Thankfully CDPR didn't give up on it and they went above and beyond to improve the experience, gave us Edgerunners, and won back the love of the players. On top of that they delivered a great dlc expansion with Phantom Liberty. I hope we get more out of this franchise down the line as it quickly became one of my top favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561199006984397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3000, 'last_played': 1734035106}
review:
Cyberpunk 2077 is the most immersive game ever. 

I started playing it a few days ago, and I can't stop. I’ve been a gamer since 1995, and I’ve played every RPG you can possibly imagine since the late 90s. Night City truly feels alive, with so much attention to detail — the immersion, animations, art design, and visuals are beyond breathtaking. I’m mind blown. It’s a haven for both eyes and ears. When I look at NPCs, what they do, their different outfits, fashions, cyber implants, actions, random events, and interior locations—wow, any game I play after Cyberpunk feels outdated, bland, and uninteresting. Cyberpunk is a game ahead of its time.
The weapon handling, choices, and driving mechanics are perfect. I thought voice acting and characters were pinnacle in Baldurs gate III, but I was so wrong, and I am happy I was wrong indeed. For the first time in my life, I’m not skipping even the smallest conversation and just walking around because the city is so dense and packed with so many things. I simply don’t want to fast travel. I’ll be honest: I’m scared, shocked, and amazed by how insanely well-done Cyberpunk is, scared yes and very rarely I’m scared when playing a game. The bizarre, twisted future of cyberware, implants, and characters feels so incredibly real. I can’t believe it. The fact you can watch TV, go on net, purchase, craft, modify use braindance and all these little things as well adds further to quality ,complexity and immersion. I must praise sense of humor too. Anything I can think off is superb.
I didn’t have high expectations for it, but this is unbelievable. I’m so passionate about gaming. Every few steps, I just stop and zoom in on the details, trying to take it all in. How did they do this? How is it even possible? For the first time in my life, I find myself lost in such a complex world. Everything in this game has been crafted masterfully, and to make it even better, the combat is so versatile with so many choices. I’m totally overwhelmed. This game is striking me on so many levels. I feel so tiny and insignificant, especially in the crowd of NPCs, and when walking and looking up at massive structures and tall skyscrapers. The character design is, without a doubt, the best I’ve ever seen as well. Dear God, I don’t know how to explain it—maybe some things can only be felt. Cyberpunk is infinite joy and fun for me.
Massive thanks to the developers. When you have a team of dedicated, talented geniuses, magic happens. Also, I want to say that the prediction of the future is very accurate.
Thank you all for reading and stay safe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198883188381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7142, 'last_played': 1724060689}
review:
I've bought Cyberpunk in summer 2022. Back then version of game was 1.52 and minor (sometimes not) bugs appeared during gameplay, but despite everything game has kidnapped me. I haven't played Deus Ex or Ghostrunner, but at first time when started to play I got the feeling like it's GTA with some role playing elements set in futuristic cybercity. And at this point, it was a total immersion in it's cyberworld, first run through the story until reach point of no return, then completed every gig, every NCPD, spend much time with Johnny, Panam, Judy etc. Couldn't believe that it's suddenly ended when completed everything, but this game was pure satisfaction <3

Year ago with v2.0 update and when I pre ordered Phantom Liberty DLC, it was a reason to dive back again with new story and characters which got even more memorable for me than original base game

Two years has gone since I tried it first time.. This game is like a drug, still satisfying to drive around Night City, still making calls to V's friends, still having feeling is like some unfinished business left here. So many unforgettable memories <3

10/10 Outstanding visuals, great story, huge open world, requieres much time and best action role-playing game of last years <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198059691972', 'num_games_owned': 2329, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 12182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12182, 'last_played': 1715893124}
review:
Even on release day when this game was a buggy mess, I still finished it due to the deep characters/narrative, alongside with Night City probably being the most well crafted city ever created in video game history.
Now that the game was fixed and the expansion came out, this has reached masterpiece status for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976077502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 27435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27435, 'last_played': 1718435560}
review:
They did it. A solid and fun RPG today, but I think as time progresses, I think it will be eventually remembered as a beautiful and poignant story and piece of art, like how we view a classic work of literature today, like a Joseph Conrad novel or For Whom The Bell Tolls by Ernest Hemingway (both authors works are referenced which the writers make clear nods to). I'm so happy I played it and avoided all spoilers. Absorb the story and world as you would a good book or TV series.

The best way to describe the relationship of the main game and the DLC's attributes is using a real world analogy: If the main game (NC) is Hong Kong, then Phantom Liberty (Dogtown) is the Kowloon Walled City. If you think you knew Hong Kong, wait until you learn how insane the Kowloon Walled City was. Apart from the main themes of the Cyberpunk RPG like capitalism gone amok, I liked how the game raises a point how our mortality forces us to question our life choices and the meaning of life. And how time waits for no one.

What really shocked me was how well written and how fun Phantom Liberty DLC was, and how it even surpassed the main story line in story quality, characters and world-building at times.

Regarding lifepaths, personally I think corpo V is the best V since it narratively ties in very well with Arasaka and the price of being a corporate wage slave and the corpo opening scene is my personal favourite of all three, and it even gives the opportunity to show how bloodthirsty the world is and allow V's voice actor to show both strength and vulnerability in a single scene. Corpo V also has some great lines I love. But streetkid and nomad lifepaths also ties in very nicely with achieving your best, and the finding your family in life respectively. Each lifepath also gets 1 unique mission. But ultimately the lifepaths is mostly for flavour and does not affect V's main story in significant ways.

This game affected me quite personally. Some parts I even cried, or even felt that visceral rage at the injustice or powerlessness of some characters, which no other game I played has ever done before. Wonderful voice acting, character design, character animation, fun combat, music, world building. The last time I felt the same way was The Last Of Us released almost a decade ago, and that really got me to seeing video games seriously as a new emerging medium for good stories. And good stories do not necessarily must have happy endings, but good ones meant to provoke thought and feelings, and the writers understood that incredibly well.

I played Vampire the Masquerade Bloodlines, The Longest Journey, Dreamfall and somehow I feel that they taken the best parts of those games which are flawed in their own ways (some more than others) and put it into Cyberpunk 2077 and the DLC. Really helps that you get to pilot a robot in a point and click adventure style reminiscent of the Longest Journey. I was impressed that the DLC has that Cynosure horror level which also surprised me, a nod to their ability to integrate the psychological horror of Alien Isolation. Perhaps I'll go so far as to say it surpasses the quality and dread you will feel from the "Ocean House Hotel" level within Vampire the Masquerade Bloodlines. Not to mention Judy's cabin mission and underwater level is unforgettable.

The music in this game is fantastic. Even the character creation menu has its own theme song, and that is one of my favourite pieces. There is even a Chopin piece played by Arasaka's sister, a complete break from the usual electronic or rock music played in the BGM and in world music. That should tell you how awesome the music is. You even get to hear some of Silverhand's band Samurai's rock music pieces. There is a whole station playing songs from Nina Kraviz as you drive through Night City. She even appears as a minor ripperdoc character, which is ironic because she is a trained dentist while V makes an offhand remark to Viktor that they feel like being at a dentist's.

This game had characters that talked like human beings, have their own fears and desires which drive their characters which drive the story. Cherami Leigh has delivered one of the best performances in this game as V, and she has acting range, from joy to anger to fear and despair, you'll feel every moment of it. It certainly helps that Keanu Reeves plays Johnny Silverhand and V's wingman, and is with you almost throughout the entire story, and it would be a completely different game without him throwing his opinions, grows as a character and has his plot brings in the same existential questions about the nature of consciousness as Soma did. I expected Idris Elba to become Stringer Bell from the Wire, but what I saw was a restrained performance of a conflicted and world weary government agent, but in a way that is realistic and still ultimately human. Carla Tassara as Judy really performed and gave one of the most heartbreaking and real performances I felt in a video game ever in one of the scenes, felt too close to home at one point that I had to stop and take a breather. Erica Lindbeck as Misty in both the main game and DLC as V's mother figure had her moments as well, especially in the storage room outside the El Coyote Cojo Bar (another extremely real scene) and also at the ending of the DLC on the staircase. Michael Gregory as Johnny Mnemonic's Spider inspired Viktor Vektor delivers some great scenes as V's father figure in the main game and DLC. The scene where Arasaka Sr and Jr are fighting in Japanese is on another level, like you are watching a forbidden family drama unfold in a foreign language. There are many more voice actors that bring in their best in this, so it is best you experience their performances yourself.

They got into some deserved criticism over game breaking bugs or over-promising in their marketing. But at this point, I think it just became irrelevant in hindsight with the eventual fixes and expectations becoming re-balanced after COVID. Also helped that the Cyberpunk anime on Netflix and DLC attracted new players who were previously uninterested in the game, and see the game for what it is: a masterpiece that needed more time for polish, minor features and fixes. They did not compromise on the story and characters and acting and world building, and that everything technical can always be patched in the end.

It is a shame that the REDengine it runs on will no longer be used in the next Cyberpunk and choosing Unreal instead: this game alone proves it can be used for horror, RPGs (Vampire the Masquerade cough cough with safe areas), racing etc.

I don't know how the team in CD Projekt Red pulled this off, but thank you for making a piece of art that will surely be remembered fondly for generations.

This review is borderline rambling because I'm speaking from the heart for the most part. It's better you experience it first hand yourself instead of watching someone else play it over YouTube because there is much more depth and beauty in this game that should be experienced first hand. If you're still skeptical, I can only quote Silverhand in Keanu Reeves's best scene in the game as he delivers his monologue (or manifesto? hehe), followed by his best line in the game: "You still don't see it. But you will one day." Every time I think about the ending of the DLC, see my world I live in and read the papers, sometimes that quote pops up now in my head reminding me how Silverhand is ultimately right in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059779819', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 918, 'playtime_forever': 20183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6400, 'last_played': 1733050021}
review:
The game is a real buy recommendation. I have to be honest, I would never have thought CD Projekt RED would release such a killer title. The large number of mods will make the game legendary for a long time to come, similar to GTA5.

Anyone who has played Deux Ex will love it. The world literally swallows you up and you just want to do that one quest or knock down the evil gang members on the street. Over time you notice how you get stronger and specialization gradually pays off more and more through super-powerful cyberware. The story is of course very well done and different possible answers produce different results, so there are multiple outcomes, violence is not always the solution. The graphics are of course an insanely massive smash hit, the different weather effects combined with the immersive world are a real feast for the eyes. Good gaming hardware is of course required.

In terms of gameplay, the open world feels like GTA5, the stealth factor like Hitman, the cyberware augmentations are very reminiscent of the game Restricted Area (2004), which you should also try out, it's really good. The perks and the general world setting are like Deux Ex Human Revolution.

Looting fun is of course not neglected either, but some enemies cannot be looted, no matter what angle you are standing at, the game crashed once, but that was it. It has been heavily optimized and is no longer as buggy as it was at release.

All in all, a very good game that I can only recommend. The game will give me many more hours of entertainment, because there is a lot to do and discover. The DLC: Phantom Liberty is also a must-buy, then the fun continues straight into the next round.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983513268', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3064, 'last_played': 1735556123}
review:
This is one of those games that I wasn't overly impressed with at launch, and a list of problems a mile long. It was poorly optimized, the gameplay wasn't as fluid and it simply landed up not feeling as good as the sum of all its parts.

Fast forward to today, and I can gladly (and proudly) say that CD Projekt Red listened to feedback. They went back and poured their heart into this game, and made it good. They took away a lot of the clunky feelings to the game and made it into a fun smash em rpg. I found myself very enthralled with the world, connected to the characters, and absolutely loved the absolute attention to detail they put into both the game and the subsequent anime that followed. They literally have locations you see in the anime, in the game. (Sidenote: if you like the game the anime is a must.)

This is one of the few games that pushes my rig to it's limits. So make sure you have a good pc to get the best experience from it. I have an RTX3090 and get around 60 fps with most details turned on. Which is playable but does show how this game will take a relatively newer gpu to really get the perfomance you need to play optimally. It is beautiful scenery when you can play with it on higher settings, so this is one of those games that I lean towards quality graphics over FPS.

As far as story goes, I love that you can start off with a little variation and really build up your characters background a little. I haven't beaten the entire game yet, but know that it has not disappointed in any way on this front. Even the side quests are fun and feel impactful. Its not just the same quests over and over, and there is a lot of variety here.

I consider this game a must play now that they've done the hard work to make it right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824938605', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1009, 'playtime_at_review': 2924, 'last_played': 1736001960}
review:
I'm glad to be able to play Cyberpunk 2077 for the first time in version 2.2 Update.

This game is not just a game to me. The world feels alive and so does every character in the story and side stories. Truly alive and fantastic. I've played countless games in my life but this experience changed my life. I know it's just a stupid video game how can it be so amazing?! Yeah I have no idea. I can't put it into words but this is such an immersive and mature game. It is funny and emotional and real, raw and deep. I love being in the world of this game. I love replaying this game which I never do usually. This game makes me feel things and that is quite an accomplishment trust me :). Every inch of this game and its world is interesting to me and playing through the story doesn't feel like you're doing missions like in most games but it feels like a natural progression and unfolding of a complex and unprecedentely deep narrative. There is also such an incredible feeling of evolution in the story, once you think you know what the stakes and direction are going to be the game throws something completely unexpected at you which changes your adventure and investment in this new adventure.

The cast is also amazing for this game, giving the characters life and memorable moments. Combat mechanics are great, and being able to mod yourself with cyber-ware is one of the coolest experiences I've seen in a game. This game is more than just a visual marvel-it's a storytelling powerhouse and a showcase of how thoughtful design can immerse players completely into a world. Simply put, it's a must-play, especially for those who appreciate deep narratives and richly designed worlds. This alone doesn't include the Phantom Liberty DLC which I think is extraordinary and may be a separate review. Peace, Chooms!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131783900', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10771, 'last_played': 1728368541}
review:
genuinely fantastic. 
lots of care taken to let you step into V's shoes and get 'into character.' take a swig of your beer before intimidating the bartender into giving up info... stop somewhere scenic and take in the view while you listen to the brief for a prospective job...
combine this with some wonderful writing & compelling quests (especially if you grab that dlc!!) and this game just rocks.
also the actual gameplay and perk trees are fantastically fun to play with post 2.0: i am partial to throwing knives and shotguns. 
knives are meant for stealth but by god i make it work anyway. i have yet to receive any complaints, likely on account of neurotoxin making people very quiet
10/10

revision:
i cannot date bootlicker grandpa. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197990953946', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15505, 'last_played': 1716712440}
review:
So it took some time to put down my thoughts on this game properly. I've played the game twice once at launch and I just wrapped up the second playthrough, both were 100% completion with all the endings.

At launch the game was a mess, but I lucked out with a good pc so was able to enjoy it for what it was with the believe of what could be. As there was a true once in a life experience hiding behind all the T poses and car crashes. Back then I already loved the game and saw it as one of my favorites ever but it was nothing to recommend at the time due to its rough shape (or shape at all if you were trying to play on last gen consoles). I can now wholeheartedly recommend this game. The characters, the story paths, the city, the fun builds it all just checks out and it all comes together as one of the most immersive experiences I've ever had. Just sitting down and looking at the city while listening to some music in game can just be so calming after a heartbreaking experience.

Phantom Liberty put things in a cinematic overdrive and lead to some choices where I still don't know what the right choice would have been. Normally that is something I'd heavily dislike but given how there are no real winners in Night City I'd say it fits very well and just gives me more time to think about it all.

Conclusion would be a very strong recommendation for a game that had an abysmal launch, but got fixed up to where it should be. The game still has bugs but none are game breaking from my experience and even though I'm glad they fixed it up, it should have never released in the state that it did. Also to truly understand how beautiful the game is you'd need a fairly beefy pc where the true potential only unlocks with path tracing enabled. Now all there is to do is wait for a follow up, and in a few years time another full completion.

~ Today was a good day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092197887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4726, 'last_played': 1727756770}
review:
Having waited a significant amount of time before playing this game, I'm glad I did. It's a great product at this point. 

The performance/visuals are very impressive. I mostly ran at medium settings, but everything still looked good. 
Love the characters and the attention to detail. Using real actors certainly added to the authenticity. 
Gameplay is fun, though not very difficult on the default settings. There's a good number of routes you can build your character in. Story is also very good (including DLC), and the multiple endings provide good variety.

My main complaint was that with the size of the world and number of quests, I often would have no idea who or what a given quest was in my journal. You'll often receive quests via a phone call while doing something else, so they're hard to keep track of, even with the information given.

Overall, one of the best open-world RPGs I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070316379', 'num_games_owned': 9877, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 3917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3917, 'last_played': 1725913580}
review:
I recommend Cyberpunk 2077 but cautiously. 

I'm shocked at how incredible this game looks, a whole 4 years after release. 
It's truly mindboggling. It is still easily the most beautiful game, not even counting mods which makes it almost photorealistic. 
The city is the main character of the game, every little corner is so rich, so detailed, so breathtaking. 
The other thing that is so well crafted are the side characters. 
Particularly Panam. 

CD PROJEKT is an expert at crafting female characters, and the romances specifically. 
I fell in love twice, first with Shani from Witcher 3, and now with Panam. 
I would genuinely get excited to see her and talk to her. The writing is great in this case. 

BUT.

The game overall, that is the gameplay, shows its age. 
It gets repetitive, with a ton of side missions that don't bring anything to the table besides being fillers. 
The map is very obsolete, a gazillion icons that, granted, you can filter out, but when you're into the game you worry about missing something so you keep them on. Except there is rarely something special about them. 
Initially I was doing them all but half way through I just got bored to be honest. 

I fully expect Witcher 4 to evolve from this system, particularly the handholding part which shows you where everything is with yellow dots and where you have to go. There is beauty in mystery and exploration, something that you can experience in FromSoft games and Wukong. Cyberpunk just uses the old Ubisoft busy-work mission structure that I, and I'm sure many, are tired of. 

On a personal note I was also turned off by the Male V protagonist, namely the voice actor. He just does a bad job, he doesn't sound natural like a normal human, his acting and voice are over the top broey, like Kyle Crane. 
To be honest, I also don't like Geralt's voice acting, although in this case you could say his voice has some sort of brand particularity, whereas V is just a parody of a normal person. 

Finally, the bugs. After all these updates, there are still a TON of bugs. Granted I don't know how it was initially, I imagine it must have been a lot worse and progress was made. But you should know that there are game breaking bugs still present, and many of them. 

A lot of important side missions will stop updating. You would expect a phone call that never comes no matter how much you progress and what you do, this goes for many missions. And those are side character missions. You can look this up, there are all kinds of work-arounds for it to this day that don't always work. 
And the main mission, the best ending, was broken for me. I restarted it twice and both times at some point the game bugs out, certain robot enemies become invulnerable, even at 0HP and the story cannot progress unless you kill them. 

So I wasn't able to even see my favorite ending. 

I would still recommend the game, for the culture, for the gorgeous visuals, the fun gunplay. 
However I stay mixed, and would give this a 7 at best, even without its bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014979577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 14761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13230, 'last_played': 1735240689}
review:
I've finished it once in the launch week, and now I'm on my third playthrough on the latest patch 2.13. Let me tell you one thing no one else will: The Cyberpunk Redemption Arc is BS. Cyberpunk in 2024 is 90% the same game as it was in 2020, it's the same city, same story, same gameplay. Plus one DLC, some bugfixes and a short list of goodies. It was an excellent game at launch too, people just wanted to be a part of the hate train back then. After the successful anime those who haven't played it actually tried it, and now we ended up with this "they fixed the game" fiction to rationalize past overreactions.

(also CDPR hyped up the game to a point where no game can deliver, no matter how good it is. Never let marketing department this much loose.) 

This game not being Overwhelmingly Positive will forever bother me. As of 2024, this is still one of the all-time best experiences ever made. Even four years after release, it's in its own category. Night City is the perfect setting to tell this fantastic story, there is something to see at every turn, so many memorable characters, meaningful choices, all told in a first-person, very immersive way. Music is great, combat is great, and very diverse in how you can approach it. Of course the graphics and the artwork is on its own class, there isn't another game in this genre that looks better than this.

I could go on, whatever, if you haven't played it because of the initial shitstorm, you should play it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058834050', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5458, 'last_played': 1723958174}

author: {'steamid': '76561198289067309', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 7187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2031, 'playtime_at_review': 7111, 'last_played': 1736217972}
review:
What happiness I find myself in at this moment. I just got all trophies in this masterpiece.

I know, I know, first impressions are what leave a mark, and this game had its image tarnished right after launch with bugs that made it unplayable. However, I must base this analysis on my experience, which was peaceful and smooth—no bug prevented me from enjoying the game (sometimes, quite the opposite; seeing my car fly into space was hilarious!).

The story of this game is phenomenal—dense and full of nuances. Not just the main story, but also the magnificent side plots that add even more depth and personality to the world. Night City is a living organism; there’s always something happening, whether it's an operation from one of the game’s “factions,” which are amazing, by the way. The mysticism they bring further enriches the creation of the cyberpunk atmosphere.

Before I started playing, I was already comparing it to The Witcher 3, even unintentionally. I believed the enemies wouldn’t have much variety and would all be similar to the soldiers from The Witcher. However, I was pleasantly surprised—the diversity of enemies in this game is quite impressive. How you deal with them is up to you. Diving deeper into this aspect, I’d say there are two gameplay styles you can adopt: stealthy or all-out combat. It may sound simple, but the game presents various tools and mechanics that assist you in different ways. I genuinely enjoyed the gameplay and how it works, and I believe that even if you’re not a fan of first-person games, you should give it a chance.

The characters are fantastic! Each one has their universe and perspective. The way V interacts with them is masterfully done. I don’t think I’ll ever forget this work’s storyline, mainly because of its characters. They were developed with such passion and care that you start getting attached to them. Johnny Silverhand will stay in my head just like he does in V’s. Panam and Judy will remain in my heart. The questline involving Evelyn is soul-crushing, and I believe it has the same impact as the Bloody Baron’s story in The Witcher 3—it’s etched into my memory.

Now, speaking about the DLC, Phantom Liberty: my friends, what a masterpiece!! Also comparing it to The Witcher 3 – Blood and Wine, I suspected it couldn’t be as well-constructed and innovative. I thought it would be more like the other DLC, Hearts of Stone, but how wrong I was, haha. Dogtown is as magnificent as Toussaint. It’s practically a whole new universe, brimming with nuances and fresh personality. Regarding the storyline—oh, what a story! It could easily be considered a completely new game. It’s a narrative that draws you into the characters’ dilemmas and immerses you in their backstories. So Mi will always have a place in my heart. Reed is a layered character—hard to understand at first, but over time, you feel like you can treat him as a brother by the end. The DLC, in addition to presenting us with a fantastic story, further enriches the main one we have in Night City.

I consider Cyberpunk 2077 another masterpiece by CD Projekt Red. The developer has definitely redeemed itself after the shameful launch.

I strongly recommend playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199442512814', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'deck_playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1724156578}
review: It took me a long time to fall in love with Cyberpunk. The legacy of The Witcher weighed heavily on me, and I kept trying to find echoes of CD Projekt Red’s past game in this new world. Getting used to the mechanics, UI, and UX took time. But eventually, the game won me over. It’s great ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198348792525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 13678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 570, 'playtime_at_review': 5727, 'last_played': 1736828672}
review:
Transcending its extraordinary technical prowess, this game unfolds as an exquisitely poignant commentary on the inexorable trajectory of human evolution, intertwining the complexities of identity, the relentless ascent of technology, and the fragile essence of our very existence. It compels us to grapple with the far-reaching ramifications of unbridled advancement, invoking profound reflections on the moral intricacies of innovation. In its most profound depths, this experience incites one to interrogate the very nature of autonomy in a reality where infinite potential is inextricably entwined with invisible confines. It is not merely a digital experience but an elevated, philosophical odyssey, a meticulous dissection of the existential predicaments that accompany humanity’s ceaseless quest for transcendence in a rapidly unfolding future.

And in the end, was it even worth it?

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037051426', 'num_games_owned': 1841, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 5723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 706, 'playtime_at_review': 5723, 'last_played': 1735739134}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043577873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1727283131}
review:
Outstanding!

Rarely have I ever been more appealed by a game right from the beginning. I think I can count the games that had a similar impact on one hand. 
The story so far is engaging and pushes for more exploration. Side quests are also very well designed with thought-out dialog options and relatable characters.
The setting took some minutes to get used to, however was very easy to side with - best part is that there's simply no comparable game out there.
Visuals and sound effects are perfect - game is very well optimized as well.
I am running the game on all ultra settings and get between 90 and 150 FPS with no lags at all.

I can definitely recommend this to anyone that has not bought it yet. Even worth the full price imho.

I'll so far rate it a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127766911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4334, 'last_played': 1722277403}
review: Fantastic game with the occasional bug, but story is phenomenal, along with the setting. The game play has many fun and interesting avenues to go through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041950545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15864, 'last_played': 1735121967}
review:
CD Projekt Red have done it again, When we talk about an unfinished big Triple A games we always think of the corporate greed and them shipping us the unfinished work of a hard-working studio and will always think of the studio as the underdog that didn't and won't have a say in it, and rarely do these studios deliver in a Big way!
CD Projekt Red is one of these few studios that would take the time to polish their craft in the most beautiful way ever; before jumping to their next project.
We saw this happen with Witcher 3, I actually was one of the few who didn't play that game until 2-3 years have passed and when I did I quickly became a huge fan of it.
When I saw Cyberpunk back in 2020 and the state it was in, I really was hopeful that this studio will one day deliver as they did with The Witcher 3, so I bought the game at that time, and didn't play much of it and I waited.. and waited
And Just December of last year (2023) I started playing it, and ohh boy did they deliver in a big way; as I do to this day keep playing it, hoping to get all the achievements soon (got 2 to go :D)

Would very much recommend it to everyone who wants a rich Blade Runner like open world game with great Quests and Side quests as it is one of the best things that CD Projekt Red is known for. 

Final Thought: Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198867124556', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 396, 'playtime_forever': 10795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 486, 'playtime_at_review': 2831, 'last_played': 1736457655}
review:
[h1] TL;DR: Game good now. [/h1]

I am a day one player, I was there during the disastrous launch of this game. I can say without hesitation that my first experience was a roller-coaster of bugs, crashes, and frustration, especially playing on a PS4! It was a mess. However, there was something about this game that kept me hooked.

Despite the flaws, this game managed to captivate me in a way few games ever have. It became the first game I ever platinumed, something  that I never achieved with other games, and I beat the game not once, but twice! I am a sucker for a good narrative, and Cyberpunk 2077 kept me playing because of its storytelling and characters and its fascinating world.

Fast forward to 2024, I am revisiting the game again (for the DLC), starting my third playthrough, this time on PC. With the recent updates, the transformation is remarkable. The world feels more alive, the improvements evident in every corner. Quality of life updates have polished the experience, making it smoother and more enjoyable than ever.

To those still on the fence about diving into Cyberpunk 2077, now is the time. The game has evolved from its troubled beginnings into something truly special. The narrative depth, the immersive world, and the unforgettable characters make it an experience worth having. Despite its rocky start, Cyberpunk 2077 has secured its place as my all-time favorite game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098717872', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1725771670}
review:
[h1] Cyberpunk is a fantastic and fun open-world game. [/h1]

I originally skipped out and overlooked on Cyberpunk 2077 from its initial launch in 2020 because it didn't look as appealing and interesting to me at the time. However, I decided and recently bought it at the end of 2023 on sale. I have to say it is a very good game. The stories and quests are interesting and the amount of customization options and stuff you can do in the game, is basically up to your desire and there's generally no limits. To me cyberpunk 2077 is like GTA but set in a futuristic city/world. Your able to do jobs to make money, go to clubs and hang out, and customize your character however you want. There's just a ton of stuff available to do!

What finally sold me on picking up Cyberpunk is finding out about the many mods from cars, to character customization options that are available to download by excellent and talented mod creators. I am having a lot of fun going around and doing jobs, interacting with people in the world and sometimes battling with the police and enemies, and also driving around my car collection. The environment and photo mode options are great too. 

If you played GTA or similar games and like open world style games or are like me and just want to do as you please with no set limits or structure involved, I highly recommend picking up Cyberpunk 2077.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993619272', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 6852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2101, 'playtime_at_review': 6852, 'deck_playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1736229992}
review:
Honestly I kinda dislike CDPR and i've been a big hater of this game for years, but I recently got extremely ill and needed something I could lose myself in so I booted up a friend's copy of the game and was surprised at how invested I got into the characters and world. I had never played before 2.2 but the game was mostly glitch free for me and the stuff they have added recently for QOL was super welcome, can't imagine playing without some of it.

I honestly really loved every minute of it and it made some really hard weeks into GOOD weeks. It's a game I will think about for quite sometime. I do kinda hope, if they do a sequel, they kinda...smooth the narrative pacing out a bit though, its hard to do all the content and not have extremely EXTREMELY long pauses and the main story is so short I felt like it was shorter than all of Phantom Liberty??? Bizarre but still really good, spent most of today getting all of the endings and I feel very fulfilled!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074757486', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3897, 'last_played': 1721672845}
review:
Amazing story, a lot of interesting characters, great rpg mechanics (highly rewarding and customisable combat system) and one of the best open worlds in gaming history with stunning visuals and a great city to explore. The launch may has been a disaster but now it's a masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005412033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 43743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7240, 'playtime_at_review': 24096, 'last_played': 1736466604}
review:
After Starfield, and Dragon Age Veilguard. I had to reinstall this game to remind myself that not everyone has sold their soul to pander to fringe lunatics.

Here we have adult themes, characters that are more than their gender, real, well developed, fleshed out entities that you can love, hate, want to help, want to hurt, want to stop, want to remove from the universe. Where the story is more important than the fear of upsetting some group of professionally offended safe space snowflakes.

We have everything in this game, from the depths of depravity to the ultra realistic "normal" people trying to live their lives as best as they can, sometimes doing "good" sometimes doing "bad" who gets to decide what is good or bad though? that is entirely subjective on where you stand, just like in the real world. 

And it is that complexity that sucks you in and enables CP2077 to have a living breathing world, and not some one dimensional snoozefest.

This game and its amazing DLC Phantom Liberty are beacons of what is possible in the current sea of mediocrity, a lighthouse, lighting the way for any adult out there who wants to escape from the stress and absurdity of gender politics in the real world and not have it take over their hobby space.

So dive right in, and lose yourself in the darkly beautiful sci fi masterpiece that is Cyberpunk 2077.

The game is most assuredly worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200593901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5747, 'last_played': 1720114733}

But that's not a bad thing. play it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198178528730', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 19509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16050, 'last_played': 1733810517}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019049436', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 13066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12577, 'last_played': 1735432013}
review:
Despite some minor bugs and goofs in the final version of the game it runs pretty well even with a bunch of mods on top.
The story is a little bit too rushed (I understand that it is set up in a way that justifies it), especially when you consider how much stuff there is aside from the main story and side-missions. In my opinion, while there's a lot of world building being done via main characters in gigs, there's a distinct lack of character building surrounding some secondary characters (yes, Panam, Judy, Kerry and the likes have pretty fleshed out glimpses into their lives at crucial moments). Take Alt, for example, she is basically the key actor in the whole Soulkiller saga, yet all we get is a story mission and that's it. Misty, while not being directly involved, is our friend and not giving her at least one side-mission where we do, Idk, something mundane, like visiting the columbarium is kinda sad. 

Anyway, gameplay-wise Cyberpunk 2077 is pretty solid. All key systems have been streamlined since the 2.0 update, so you can focus more on exploring the world rather than figuring out how to mod your pants.

Overall, it's a pretty solid game, not 10/10, of course, but a solid 9/10 for sure, with the key driving force being gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043273274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 31554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 215, 'playtime_at_review': 23431, 'last_played': 1736706602}
review: I can't get enough learning and exploring about this game and it's night city universe.  The history, present and future of night city is always fascinating to be in.  This game makes other RPGs feel like they miss a huge point in RPG, which is not just character oriented, but rather universe oriented.  There's so much more than just Vs story and his Role in this universe.  I will be exploring pretty much for the rest of my life.  Thank you Mike Pondsmith for the universe you created and CD proj red for creating it in digital art.

author: {'steamid': '76561199019162063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 86, 'playtime_at_review': 4806, 'last_played': 1736786255}
review: Game is often overlooked and considered broken, this may have been true back in it's early release, but this game's endings and many different choices make it one of the best story games of all time, if Cyberpunk 2077 was released in full this year, it would've for sure won game of the year. Worth the time, worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561199022786909', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2733, 'last_played': 1719689026}
review:
This game wasn't released so well, had so many problems along the way, got so much attention in a bad way that affected its market, and it's come a long way now, but the devs didn't just leave it behind, with constant updates and patches, I can confidently say that this is one of the absolute best games you can find in the whole history of gaming, and a great example of how games should be made and released and taken care of. this'll be a long review but I plan to try to review the game in different perspectives. It will be completely spoiler free. Hope you enjoy. 

[LORE]  
First up let's talk about the story and the lore. I never expected it to have such a huge world and plot, it's amazing, the details and everything. it seems like it's taken from a novel series, it's THAT deep and well written. You as the main character V, make decisions and those decisions are important, they matter and will determine how the story goes on. you can interact with characters and the world your own way by choosing voice lines and deciding different stuff. All this not only determine your fate, but also the characters' fates, and your relationships with them, and of course the overall story and its progress. 
So basically, Cyberpunk 2077 totally immerses you in its lore by giving you options like these and some very difficult decisions you'll have to make throughout the game. However, you'll actually completely get what I said up here IF you play the side quests and try to complete at least some of them. This is one of those games you really shouldn't rush. the side quests are totally worth it. worth everything. 
There are multiple side quests that some go very deep and are attached to important characters, so those side quests also determine your relations with those certain important characters, such as Judy, River and Panam. 

[GAMEPLAY]
 The game is in first person, but you can change it to third person when driving. There are all kinds of weapons that you can modify too. You can complete missions in any way you want really. You can be stealth or go ham and get that LMG out and slaughter em all, and don't worry it doesn't necessarily affect your ending, however you must be careful what you do in certain missions and actually listen to characters' requests and guides, otherwise if you for example kill a certain npc in a certain Judy side quest, you can no longer have any side quest with Judy, but other than that in the open world and in most story or even side missions, killing enemies, being stealthy, leaving them alive or anything else doesn't really matter that much. see what suits your style.
You can drive cars and bikes and each are very different from each other in terms of how you drive them and the places you can go with them. you'll really sense that once you try some different cars. 
You can customize your character completely, even after creating it at the beginning of the game. clothes, appearance, everything pretty much. 

[GRAPHICS AND OPTIMIZATION]
The graphics are what you would expect, amazing, they've done a very good job with detailing the city, the graphics, textures and models. The options really let you change a lot in the video and graphics section based on your needs and desires for better image or better performance. Don't get too lost in it in the beginning though. You'll figure out what settings best suit you and your computer specs after playing the game a little why and testing things. 
I for example, have an RTX 2060, AMD Ryzen 5 3600, with 16 GB of 3200mhz ram, and I play on a HDD, on a 1080p 60hz monitor. I chose the High preset settings, but improved some other settings for better image, and I get like 60+ stable FPS. I didn't choose this right in the beginning, I chose it after like 5 hours into the game and testing different settings throughout the game. My game had lags at first, it eventually got fixed after some changes in the settings. 
Overall, the graphics and optimization of the game is pretty good.

[LENGTH]
The game's quite long. I played pretty much all the important side quests with important characters alongside the main quests, and it all took me about 45 hours. I'd say it could take you somewhere between 20 - 80 hours depending on how many side quests you finish and how much you explore. I didn't finish some side quests because they didn't involve any important characters and didn't contribute to the story much, but played everything else so clean and completely. 

[AUDIO AND SOUNDTRACK]
Masterpiece, unique, literally can't say enough about how good the audio and soundtrack of the game is and how much it adds to the game and experience. 
NOTHING wrong with any of it, absolutely perfect. perfect. Just for the record, I've got all the soundtrack on my phone and listen to them, and right now as I'm writing this, I'm listening to it on Steam thanks to them giving it for free after purchasing the game. 

[EDDIES]
Got it with a very good 50% discount, but it's definitely worth the base price, completely. 

[BUGS}
The game still has so many bugs and they can get annoying. They were many in the first few hours of the game but gradually got better. One other thing is that usually when I played more than 4 hours without a break, I would see some very random bugs and issues that could get so annoying, but I guess it makes sense kinda. The game is huge, gotta give it a break. 
Besides that, I didn't really notice any real bad bugs or issues in the game or the settings. This game is polished. 

[RATNG]
2077/10 Can't go wrong, one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had. 

[TIPS]
If you've read everything so far, I really appreciate your time and concern, so here's some tips I understood during the game that will free you of any need to external guides, and hopefully help you have an experience as great as mine. 

1. Save your game once in a while, sure the game has auto save but to really get the most of the game and missions and the lore, sometime you'll find yourself in need to replay a certain part of the game. try to save your game whenever you feel like something important is gonna happen or you're gonna take an important decision. you'll never know, you might need it. it will save your time. 

2. Play the side quests, trust me. even if you have to force yourself to do it, just give em a try at least, and I'm talking about the important side quests that the main characters give you. Judy, Panam, River, Claire, Delamain, Kerry, Paralezes, these are the characters you really shouldn't ignore. If you do, I can assure you you'll miss out on half of the game, in terms of everything. 

3. Be good with Johnny and he can be the most trustworthy character in the game, for the most part. sometimes when you find yourself struggling to make an important decision, Johnny is always there and talks to you. listen to him, he's not all that heartless terrorist you might think. Just don't ignore him, hear him out, sure he can sometimes say dumb things that just don't make sense to do considering the fact that you're not him, and certainly don't blindly go with him if you're completely sure about what you wanna do and what you believe is right, but I'm talking about the moments that not even you know what to do, when you're in complete confusion, lost. Listen to him, you usually won't regret it. This can be true about some other characters and situations too. Overall, don't be that lone wolf, listen to your allies. they might be right and helpful. 

Have fun in Night City, chooms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030393287', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3212, 'last_played': 1711618718}
review:
[h1] Final Cyberpunk Review (DLC Included) [/h1]

After an extremely backlash filled release in late 2020, CDPR has done their best to convert the entire game to what players were expecting to it be released as. In summary, they have done that!

Over the years, CDPR have focused immensely on bug and glitch fixes that moved it from a broken buggy mess to something distinctly playable, with that wonderful open world experience we all wanted to immerse ourselves in. 

I’m very impressed with what they’ve managed to achieve with this revision to the game and I believe it is finally living up to its full potential. With the DLC released, this brought fresh eyes to the game and allowed players of old to come back and experience a new play through of the game without those game breaking bugs they were so used to seeing previously.
I believe the game is just a lot more FUN to play. It was great because of its storytelling and design before but now it’s just better in every possible way.

Considered one of the biggest changes, is the fact that you can now engage in vehicle combat with things like car chases, shooting out tires, and shooting at each other. It’s something that was strongly needed in the game and makes the massive number of vehicles actually useful now. The various criminals and opponents in Night City are no longer nearly as limited as they used to be. This again, helps with the challenge and makes encounters things that players are going to want to take slowly. 

You can double-jump, slow time, use quick hacks and use all manner of meaningful abilities to cut your enemies into literal strands of ribbons. Fast travel points are everywhere in the large map, and dialogue can be skipped with the press of a button that visually fast-forwards time. The game has NPCs that are relatable and universally well-written, cut scenes that are engaging, and a host of great soundtrack options to accompany your playthrough. Combat is excellent and offers a wide choices of ways to take down your enemies in Night City, so you can always find a suitable way that you prefer to play.

As far as 2024 goes, having completed the main game and the DLC, Cyberpunk is a game I would replay in a heartbeat! Highly recommended to anyone who's looking to lose a bunch of hours in an immersive open world RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391126915', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 7257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6137, 'last_played': 1727032989}
review:
I found 2024 GOTY - It's here

A thing of beauty, I know...

Cyberpunk 2077 was the best story rich game I played this year and I have to say how I'm still impressed by the dialogue lines, which by the way, I haven't skipped any.
Character development is 10/10. The engagement is 10/10. The immersion is 10/10. How do you feel after finishing the game is 10000000/10

Night City is by far the most complexed city I have ever had the pleasure to explore. By the time I had my fill exploring the city, I came to a conclusion that I have never played a game that hasn't recycled anything but this one. Everything is unique, each part of the city. There's no Ctrl C Ctrl V anywhere, with the exception of some NPCs and cars, but that's it.

The gameplay is really good, although I found stealth approach not very practical, since the hitboxes are still an issue, that also applies for looting.
I found some bugs here and there, still not a perfect game, but far from a Ubisoft/Bethesda/EA experience where you need to download mods to make their games properly work.

This is the first game that really makes you choose dialogue options based on what you (PLAYER) believe, your values and principles stays on the line. It doesn't feel like a Bethesda generic driven conclusions.
This is as far as we can get of a GTA 6 first person with real tities and katana.

The soundtracks? beautifully presented with the correct timing for each occasion. The SAMURAI songs drove me crazy, Keanu Reeves and Cherami leigh voices are the just best.

Back in the day when I pre ordered this game I had the utmost disappointing experience of my life in a video game. Now, 4 years later I can finally put that memory to rest, knowing that what I have now won't fade away.

Cyberpunk 2077 - 9.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198176447279', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 23538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18263, 'last_played': 1724329257}
review:
Iam glad that i started the game after they fixed ninety percent of the bugs and released phantom libertry cause now this game is absolutely at its prime.
When i entered the night city at first , it mesmerized me with it's design and neon lights , its so good that you can just take some screenshots and make it as your wallpaper , and i love the fact that different sides of the city represents of its own quality of life within .

Besides from city , main characters in this game is just awesome , they feel so realistic with their writing , design, and this one is my favorite ; the voice acting , its really top tier. 
As for the main story ; i wouldn't give an oscar but it was good enoıugh. and for the side missions i respect that they put something meaningfull to them , instead of just killing some random bad guy , they are giving you the reasons and desicion to make for it. I also want to mention that some themes and musics are just to good.
A little note that After the cyberpunk edgerunners anime which is really good in my opinion , In-game references against anime is cherry on top .

Even the people who dont play cp77 would know that there are 3 paths you can choose at the begining of the game, they have some minor impacts in the story such as the first thirty minutes of the begining and adding some path related dialog options to feel like your following or used to follow that path you choosed 
Some players might say its changing nothing and has nothing to do in games progress and i dont agree with that much 
because i think its all about adding some persona to your playthrough rather then chaning the whole story arc just beacuse you were a corpo guy or used to hang out with nomads, it doesnt make sense.

For the gameplay part its really enjoyable and has a good amount of variety to make your own build an have fun with it
The combat system is to Satisfying that its making you wanna try different builds to get into combat with it 
Also, as a car maniac i can say that there are some good looking ones and overall driving feels very nice.
Not to mention that replayability is higher if you want to see different conclusions and differents way to get that conclusions. 

As for the cons ; i would say that the main story is a bit short if you just rush through it, i havent encontered a lot of bugs like has to be around 5-10 within three hundered hours but man , its crashing a lot , almost once or twice in a day, dont know if its because i have tons of mods or not but it is what it is. 
it has four different difficulty options and i really dont like the way they work, if you increase your diff, your character takes more damage, deals less and complete opposite for the enemy, so it has nothing unique but you could say that this is not a game stands out with difficulties. other then some personal preferences i dont think cp77 has major cons anymore . 

Lastly i think cyberpunk 77 is a prime open-world, action-adventure RPG game to give it a try at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350391140', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1722053551}
review:
To encompass any kind of existing media and make it viable for audiences new and old, including fans of said media, is a gargantuan task. No matter the circumstances of release, with the 2.1 update, fixes, Phantom Liberty and all other extra content, CDPR has proven that this was indeed the birth of the AAAA game. 

Fidelity achievements aside, they made a believer out of someone who had never bought into the hype, who was glad that people were held to the standard of the product they publish now instead of what they did in the past. I played this game at launch, and kept glancing at it at every major update.

But boy, was my mind blown with this game at its final version. There might be more games that fully immerse and engross me in the world, the story, the environment, the characters and the system, but I will never have the same epiphany I received from Cyberpunk. 

From someone who has been playing video games for more than 2 decades, this is the best gift I have ever given myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144904354', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3516, 'last_played': 1730400879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106771223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9465, 'last_played': 1717681988}
review:
I got the game on launch, played for 40-50 hours but didn't finish it, also didn't get spoiled of endings.

Came back years later with a new pc capable of maxing out graphics and with all the bug-fixes, improvements but I still had a negative bias on the story because there were parts where I thought it was cringe.

Started a new game, watched tons of videos about the back-story and connections of quests, characters, side-quests and my opinion slowly changed to very positive. 

The world building is matchless wether gameplay or story wise, graphics are phenomenal and has one of the best atmospheres especially with Ray Tracing.

Chose the secret ending and it really satisified me story wise then started the DLC and it was couple level above the main story. 

I can easily say that the DLC brings what you get from Blood and Wine DLC of Witcher 3 so %100 worth it, extra 30-40 hours of content and story. 

It's one of the best examples of dealing with the consequences of your actions and choices, making it almost mandatory to try different options after another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806761323', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 16611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16514, 'last_played': 1726787070}
review:
didnt wanna write a review until i finished the game 100% even though i did i still feel like there is so much more to do. im so glad i played this game just now and not when it dropped literally the best game i have ever played for sure top 3 ,i spent 200+ hours in the first 2 weeks ive played it and it literally became my life, i got so invested so fast with world and memorable characters and quests, there is no dull moment in night city and the new dlc dog town.
it was quite the experience. from the moment I stepped into night city, i was blown away by the sheer scale and detail of the world. the neon lights, towering skyscrapers, and gritty streets all contribute to an atmosphere that’s both immersive and hauntingly beautiful. how each district in night city has its own story and personality. the story itself is a rollercoaster, filled with twists, memorable characters, and moral dilemmas that made me question my choices. I especially enjoyed the depth of customization for my character, allowing me to truly make V my own. the game didn’t just provide an escape for me; as i navigated V’s journey, fighting to survive against all odds, I found myself drawing strength from the character’s relentless determination. The story’s themes of identity, survival, and defiance against a world set on breaking you i resonated deeply with,it really felt like I was carving my own path in this messed-up world.
the combat is intense and offers a variety of playstyles, whether you prefer going in guns blazing or taking a more stealthy, hacker approach. cyberpunk 2077 delivers a unique and engaging experience that’s well worth diving into, especially for fans of the cyberpunk genre. It’s a game that challenges you to think, adapt, and immerse yourself in a world that’s as beautiful as it is dangerous. despite its rocky launch, it has evolved into a must-play title. also JOHNNY reeeeeee i love im so much 
anyway choom dont be a gonk and grab your hottest iron and zero em saka ninjas 
love the game 11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198820867944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1734399141}
review: Game was totally worth it... I remember waiting for the game to come out so I could play it but while the controversy was at it's peak I decided it was better not to. Now that it is not a buggy mess and everything is in order I have to say that the story was fantastic and each ending gives a different aspect to think upon. Some side-missions were somewhat boring but most of them actually enhanced the story for me. Character customization is truly amazing. Loved the open world aspect of it all and fantasizing about the weird tech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198980560797', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8442, 'last_played': 1728017197}
review:
I have never had a game hit me like this one. EVERYTHING from the story, memorable characters, amazing game play, atmosphere, skill tree system, this game truly has it all. You will never get bored of this game in 2024 and beyond. This has shaped up to be one of the most incredible and time consuming games ever. Time consuming being that I have ignored my personal life in order to pursue this game and devoted numerous playthroughs just to see the slight differences in every decision I make. If you have EVER been on the fence about this game, (i was for over 2 years) please give it a try. Cherish it, you will miss seeing things for the first time. I couldnt recommend this game enough to anyone that plays any kind of game. 

2077/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980176908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5718, 'deck_playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1718743597}
review:
I first played this game four years after its release, with the Phantom Liberty expansion installed. Despite the delay, I can confidently say that this is one of the best games I've ever played. Night City feels massive and alive, almost like a character itself, full of depth and detail as any of the well-developed characters in the game.

Though it may look like Grand Theft Auto, this game is truly an RPG at heart. The numerous skill checks can significantly impact your experience. You can fail missions, lose the trust of your contacts, and even see some characters leave your life forever.

The characters are unforgettable, with many memorable moments from start to finish. Even the minor characters have full voice acting and detailed personalities with backstories. The level of detail in every aspect of this game is astonishing, especially when compared to other games released around the same time. It's clear that CDPR was on another level when they created Cyberpunk 2077. They knew what they wanted to make, and despite taking twice as long as expected, the final result is incredible.

There are many ways to build your character, and you won't be good at everything, which I love. Your choices carry weight, and if something doesn't go your way, well, that's life. I embrace my bad choices too.

I cannot recommend this game enough. If you decide to pick it up, I highly recommend installing Phantom Liberty from the start. Unlike typical DLC, which often feels like a separate mission, Phantom Liberty is seamlessly integrated into the main storyline around the mid-point of the game. It fits perfectly and even provides extra dialogue options in the main story if completed beforehand.

The care and thought put into this game are truly impressive, making Cyberpunk 2077 a prime example of what next-gen gaming should aspire to.

The graphics are stunning, with a level of detail that brings Night City to life. With Phantom Liberty, the performance has been smooth, and I've encountered very few bugs. The world is visually captivating, with incredible lighting and reflections that add to the immersive experience.

The main story is compelling, with twists and turns that keep you engaged. The side quests are equally engaging, often providing deep character insights and additional layers to the story. Every quest feels meaningful and adds value to the overall experience.

The customization options for your character are extensive, from appearance to abilities. The gameplay is diverse, allowing for various playstyles. I went for a stealth SMG/AR build with a high focus on movement abilities and it was lots of fun!

Cyberpunk 2077 is an ambitious game that delivers on many fronts. Despite its rocky launch, the game has evolved into a masterpiece. If you're a fan of RPGs and immersive storytelling, this game is a must-play. The level of detail, character development, and world-building make it a standout title in the gaming landscape.

author: {'steamid': '76561199219915809', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 7648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4202, 'last_played': 1735261750}
review:
Instead of a classic review with typical pros and cons, I would like to tell a little story here.
Once upon a time, a long time ago, there was this very interesting guy with the nickname Toko, and what many people didn't know, the name came from the character Motoko Kusanagi 
(Ghost In The Shell), which many people also didn't know at the time. The small town I lived in at the time had a basketball court in every direction, so we said either the swampy north court, the bosomy south court or the gallows-filled west court. 
Toko always and only played on the colorful east court, 
because he lived around the corner and only left the area when he had to. 
At that time basketball was a big thing for me and I went to a lot of different places to see who was the best and if I could beat them. But the east court was never really busy so I didn't go there that often, but when I did, Toko was always there. He was very secretive at first and we hardly talked until the moment he did or said something that reminded me of a movie I had seen the night before: Shadowzone. And not only did he know the movie, he also knew what year it was released and the other movies from that distribution company. 
From that day, we got on really well and pretty soon he mentioned the first time that he was playing a pen & paper game called Cyperpunk 2020 with some friends. Eventually I had to move away from that town and I never saw this guy again, but whenever anything cyberpunk related came up, I remembered that time. In 2020, when Cyberpunk 2077 was released, I was giving an online workshop on electronic music production and one of the participants told us how much he was looking forward to this game but never been so disappointed in something. We watched a lot of videos with recorded game scenes that were full of bugs and glitches and it was freakin hilarious. After that we made a small Cyberpunk Remix in 2 parts and I secretly swore to myself, someday I will play this game when it is playable at some point. And today I love it, even if it's still not perfect ;  )

author: {'steamid': '76561197966933959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6245, 'last_played': 1715386260}
review: I disliked the bugs on release but persevered through constant crashes. The second play through now many years later is a lot more fun with more to do, polished game play and less bugs

author: {'steamid': '76561198155558005', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 776, 'playtime_at_review': 2998, 'last_played': 1736723693}
review:
It took a few years, but Cyberpunk has greatly improved from a launch disaster to a beloved title. If you like the cyberpunk aesthetic and setting, this is the AAA RPG you're looking for. I did a playthrough as a netrunner, and am midway through a playthrough as a blade user. I highly recommend this if you have a GPU that can handle it.

Btw, this game gets my seal of approval for having good movement. You can dash, double jump, slide, etc.. Makes for really stylish kills.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034897594', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22198, 'last_played': 1720383923}
review:
This game is at its greatest state right now - the combat mechanics probably the pinnacle of what CD projekt red has achieved. I am quite surprised regarding their affinity for shooters and considered them to be RPG veterans and that's that. 

The character development in Cyberpunk 2077 is unfortunately not as strong as it could be, and the lifepaths are disappointing variations to an otherwise rather linear story. 

Nevertheless, the world and its writing is absolutely incredible and is undoubtedly the strongest aspect of the game. I strongly recommend this game to RPG fans with a strong desire for satisfying, fast-paced combat. If your main desire is player choice and creating a character that you can self-insert as, cRPGs are better suited to meet your needs. 

Night City is gorgeous and brimming with areas that you can explore. There isn't too much variety in terms of loot outside of weapons and cyberware... If you like cosmetics, there's a ton of loot when it comes to clothing. Other than that, it just boils down to crafting components for weapons and quickhacks. Traversal is amazing and you will LOVE to explore Night City, it's full of life and interesting locals. I adore the aesthetics and the various Gigs / side missions you come across. The star of the game is still the main mission.

Finally, the soundtrack is a 10/10 especially if you're a fan of synthwave. Play the game and enjoy the ride - it's full of goosebumps... And you WILL feel badass as V.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127565179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4589, 'last_played': 1734734955}
review:
I didnt play this game until after the 2.1updates but after putting 70+ hours, this game is excellent.

so much fun and the story is so immersive each main mission, allows me to build an emotional attachment to the game. it is so much fun and an incredible way to spend time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042773594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 11775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6960, 'last_played': 1717377591}
review: I firmly believe that if this game launched in the state that it currently is in, it would be considered among the greatest games ever made. Unfortunately, there were so many delays that the CD Project Red Executives gave the devs an ultimatum, and the game was sent through the door unfinished. BUT, they never gave up, and managed to finish the game they envisioned all those years ago. Props to the developers for sticking with this amazing game and delivering to consumers what was promised.
